She hopes that she’ll do very well and comments that what she’s liked best about working with Fondo Esperanza has been finding the group support she’s had and to start achieving all the group objectives they’ve set.

loans.use: to buy supplies and small machinery.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is training grounds for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. She has no children and has been doing farming work for 13 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Rearing dairy cows." Her biggest challenge is: "How to boost production due to low milk-producing animals." Animals on the farm have been given the names of: "Lelmok."

Hellen was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Joined Juhudi after being convinced by a neighbor."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: "How microfinance institutions work to boost farmers' income."

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked, "How will this loan benefit her family?," Hellen replied, "Will purchase a high-yielding dairy cow."

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Hellen owns the following: 'cow, poultry,' but does not own: 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile.' Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards, based on this loan. This borrower does not have in the household: 'mosquito net, electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD.'

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan de 30 años de edad, tiene una pequeña panadería ubicada al lado de su residencia, la cual trabaja en conjunto con su esposa. Diariamente inician su faena  a las 5:00 am hasta las 6:00 pm. Inició su negocio gracias al apoyo de su familia y a un curso de panificación que realizó hace algunos años.
Con el fin de aumentar su producción, gracias a la buena acogida que han tenido sus productos en el sector, Juan se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la ampliación de la planta de alimentos, el techo y la compra de una vitrina enfriadora.
Su mayor sueño es poder posicionar su negocio en el mercado local y convertirse en la número uno. Espera brindarle  a su familia una calidad de vida digna.
texts.en:
Juan, 30, has a small bakery located at home where he works alongside his wife.  They start their work day every day at 5am and continue until 6pm.  He started the business thanks to family support and a baking course he took some years ago.  

Aiming at increasing production thanks to the good reception his products have had in the sector Juan is asking for a loan to expand the food plant, to repair the roof and to buy a refrigerated display case.  His greatest dream is to position the business in the local market and become number one.  He hopes to provide his family with proper quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerated display case, expand the plant and repair the roof.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi vit avec sa femme comptable et leur enfant à Lomé. Pour jouer son rôle de père de famille, il revend des friperies au marché. Il espère renforcer son activité et ouvrir une boutique. Il est âgé de 37ans et a démarré en 2000. Une personne l'aide dans l'exécution de son activité.
texts.en: Koffi lives with his accountant wife and their child in Lomé. To fulfill his role as the father of the family, he sells used clothing at the market. He hopes to expand his business and open a shop. He is 37 years old and started his business in 2000. Koffi has one employee who helps him run his business.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 39 years old and has six children. Alma is married and has three children who are in school.

Alma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Alma has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Alma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy stock such as milk, coffee, sugar, canned goods, chips, bread, etc., to sell in her general store.

Theresa has been in this business for five years. Theresa earns more income from farming vegetables and from selling prepaid mobile load.

Theresa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock such as milk, coffee, sugar, canned goods, chips, bread, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Digna is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients and more snack foods to sell.

Digna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and more snack foods to sell.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 41 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Marissa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marissa has been farming vegetables for eight years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor, es una mujer a la que le ha tocado luchar y esforzarse por sacar adelante su negocio. Montó un restaurante con el fin de mejorar la situación económica en su casa y ofrecerles a sus cuatro hijos mejores oportunidades de vida. Labora diariamente desde las cinco de la mañana hasta las ocho de la noche. 

Su mayor sueño es consolidar su negocio y para ello se encuentra en búsqueda de un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido y una nevera con el fin de mejorar sus ventas e incrementar los ingresos. Espera poder posicionar su negocio y constituirse en una fuente de empleo en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Leonor is a woman who has had to struggle and fight to move her business forward.  She set up a restaurant aiming to improve her home’s economic situation and to offer her four children better life opportunities.  She works every day from five in the morning until eight at night.

Her greatest dream is to consolidate the business and to do so is looking for a loan that she’ll invest in stock merchandise and a freezer in order to improve sales and increase income.  She hopes to position her business and become a source of employment in her community.

loans.use: to buy basic staple items and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina, es madre cabeza de familia de tres hijos, por los cuales lucha para brindarles una educación de calidad. 
Con el fin de generar ingresos y aprovechar sus habilidades para el área de belleza, Luz decidió abrir su salón de belleza y generar mayores ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.

Asegura que la calidad de vida en su hogar ha mejorado, gracias a su labor. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la renovación de algunos equipos y  muebles. 
Uno sus mayores deseos es crecer y ampliar su negocio para convertirse en una fuente de empleo para las personas más necesitadas de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is the single-mother head of her household of three children for whom she fights so she can offer them a good education.

Luz opened her beauty salon to generate income and to make the most of her talents in field of beauty so she can support her family.  

She assures us that the quality of life in her home has improved thanks to her work.  She is currently asking for a loan to update some equipment and furniture.

One of her greatest wishes is to grow and expand her business so that it can become a source of employment for the people in her community who need it most.

loans.use: to buy work equipment and furniture

loans.name: Daphine

texts.en:
Daphine is a 32-year-old hardworking woman with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is running a restaurant alongside a bar and selling fresh bananas in order to raise income for her family.

She has a vision of building a permanent house to live in e and owning a hotel despite inadequate capital. Daphine will use the loan to buy food, beers and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy food, beers and soda to sell.

loans.name: Nhor's Group

texts.en:
An inhabitant originally from Kampong Cham province, Nhor is married and blessed with four children. Nowadays, she still needs to care for only one son as he is still in school. On one hectare of rice cropping, she is able to earn about 22,900 KHR to support the family's daily food consumption. 

Nhor has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. Now, she is in a group of three to apply for a new loan. They are seeking for the same loan amount, 1,000,000 KHR each.  

As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and fragrant rice seeds for replanting. She hopes that this purchase will enable her to grow healthy and fruitful rice so that she can make more income to sustain her lifestyle as well as to keep her kid in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fragrant rice seeds for replanting.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Romelia

texts.es: Romelia tiene 52 años,  vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos nietos. Romelia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo junto a su hija. Y además vende zapatos de una marca reconocida para obtener ingresos extras para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Gracias al apoyo de su familia pudo salir adelante y ahora tiene un stock de productos variados en su vitrina. Con la ganancia de las ventas de sus productos espera implementar su negocio y mas adelante ampliar su negocio para incrementar sus ventas y percibir más ingresos. Para Romelia este es su primer crédito con Kiva, y está muy agradecida por el apoyo económico recibido razón por la cual se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. El monto de S/.1500.00 lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos como talcos, labiales, delineadores, etc.  para surtir su negocio y dinamizar sus ventas.
texts.en: Romelia is 52 years old and she lives in her own home with her husband and their two grandchildren.  Romelia sells cosmetics via catalog with her daughter for a living.  She also sells popular brands of shoes to make extra income to improve her family's quality of life.  Thanks to her family's support, she was able to get ahead and she now has a supply of different kinds of products in her display case.  With the profits from selling these products, she hopes to carry on with her business and, in the future, expand it to increase her sales and see more profits.  This is Romelia's first loan with Kiva and she is very thankful for the financial help she has received, which is why she promises to make her payments on time.  She will invest the 1,500 soles in cosmetics, such as powders, lipsticks, eyeliners, etc., to stock her business and stimulate sales.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to grow her business

loans.name: Adima

texts.en: Adima is a 39-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a teacher for 14 years and works eight hours a day at Rwenzori High School but also does farming to earn extra income. He was inspired into service by his love for young children and his dreams are to educate his children up to university and also to upgrade his studies, as his aim is to become a school principal. Adima intends to use the loan to start a retail shop dealing in general merchandise such as soap, sugar and rice.

loans.use: to start a retail shop dealing in general merchandise such as soap, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
Ra, 40, is a citizen from Kampong Cham province and a mother of four children. To tackle the hardship, she does rice cultivation and sells fish as the main source of family’s income while her husband supplements their income via a house building business. Ra has been engaged in her current business since she was around 20 years old, and is able to earn about 29,700 KHR per day. 

This is the third loan for Ra with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). After the successful loan which she has repaid back completely, she can manage to support her business on time. Now she is in a group of four applying for a new loan. She and other two joint members are seeking for 1,100,000 KHR each while a remaining member is applying for 800,000 KHR. 

As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to gain high yield from her crop husbandry, so she can set aside some money to buy a tri-cycle motorbike to support her fish-selling business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is a forty-year-old married woman with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. For sixteen years she has been operating a drug shop business and also does farming to earn additional income.

She hopes to expand her business to a bigger drug shop however, lack of enough capital is her challenge. Justine intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Saren's Group

texts.en:
A mother of two kids—one of whom is in school, Saren is 45 years old and a villager from Kampong Cham province. She supports the daily cost of living for herself and her family by growing rice on one hectare of land. She has been engaged in this business for 25 years and supports her family by generating about 33,900 KHR per day. 

This is the first micro-loan for Saren with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she leads a group consisting of four female members including her. She and two other members are seeking for 1,000,000 KHR each whereas a remaining member is applying for 700,000 KHR. 

Saren will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed and to pay plowing fees. She hopes that this purchase will enable her to make more income and to expand her business better than before.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and to pay plowing fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en:
Sim, 54 and married, is a mother of five children, living in Kampong Cham province. She has managed a half-hectare area for rice cultivation with the support from her husband. She is able to earn up to KHR 27,400 per day. 

Sim has never been with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner), she and her co-borrower are first-cycle clients. The total amount of her group loan is KHR 400,000, of which KHR 300,000 is her loan portion. 

As the leader, Sim will spend her loan portion to buy potash for her farmland. She believes that this purchase will boost her crop output on-time and return to her a good yield, with a high profit.

loans.use: to buy potash for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 50 years old and has six children. Thelma is widowed and has two children who are in school.

Thelma is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Thelma requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock and feeds for her business.

Thelma has been raising livestock for three years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Thelma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock and feeds for her business.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz used the previous loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business. He is a married hardworking man living Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is involved in the transport business and also owns a retail shop. Price fluctuations, customers not paying on time, and high taxes pose a challenges to his growth. 

His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent home while business goal is to own at least five motorcycles since his business is very lucrative and he has so far bought two motorcycles. 

Aziz intends to use the loan to buy a new motorcycle and he expects the hired rider to remit 80% of the daily earnings.

loans.use: to buy a new motor cycle.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen is a 29 year old, married woman who lives in Kasese, Uganda. She has a transportation business and also earns a salary as a civil servant. She began her business to supplement her monthly income to achieve a better livelihood. Like most people in the transport sector, she is faced with the challenge of high fuel costs, as well as the failure of the hired driver to remit the money he owes on time. Her dream is to renovate her house and upgrade her studies so she can get a better job. Doreen intends to use the requested loan to renovate her house.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Nhong's Group

texts.en:
Nhong, a citizen from the Mongkol Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, is a rice grower on three hectares. She is 61 years old and a mother of seven children who have their own jobs already. For her 30 years involvement in farming, she manages to earn about 25,000 KHR per day. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is a fourth-time borrower. She has fully repaid her past loans, which has improved her lifestyle. 

For this cycle, she has formed a group of two to apply for a new loan. She is seeking 700,000 KHR, while her co-borrower is seeking 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash for her farmland and insecticide for her crop. She hopes that she can boost her crop productivity and double her income to enlarge her farmland.

loans.use: to buy potash for her farm and insecticide for her crop.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
Neang, age 33 and married, is a citizen in a rural village of Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham. She has three children, two of whom are still under her responsibility as they are in school. To provide for her family's daily needs, she works on a rubber plantation and trades latex for extra income. Currently, she is able to earn about 28,000 KHR per day. 

This is the second loan for Neang with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She can afford to provide three decent meals for her kids and to build a decent house for her family from the original loan which she has fully repaid back. Now, she leads a group of three to apply for a new loan. 

She is seeking 1,200,000 KHR while her other two members are seeking 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy more latex to resell. She hopes to increase her income so as to upgrade her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy more latex to resell.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
In her early 30s, Srey is a married mother of two kids who are students in a local state school in Kampong Cham province. She strives for a living via rice farming and working for others for a fee. To supplement the family’s income, her husband also sells coconuts. The current business, which she has had for 11 years, gives her about 32,500 KHR per day. 

This is not the first loan for Srey with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has completely repaid back her past two cycles with success and it has enabled her to strengthen her business promptly. Now, she is in a group of three applying for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and gasoline to pump water for her crops. 

She highly believes that she can gain triple yield from her current business so that she can make more income to buy an additional plot of farmland to replant more rice crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline to pump water for her crops.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Blanca Lucia

texts.es: Doña blanca de 64 años de edad vive junto a su hija  en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos, tiene 3 años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio está ubicado en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden y al gusto de los clientes; doña blanca es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y muy luchadora día con día se esfuerza al máximo para ganarse una vida mejor quiere realizar una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa, cosméticos por mayor, doña blanca  tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Blanca is 64 years old and lives with her daughter in her own home.  She sells clothing and cosmetics for a living.  She has had her business for three years, during which time she has gained a lot of experience, which has allowed her to improve her profits.  Her business is located in the market near her home.  She has built up a large clientele because people know that everything she sells is of good quality at reasonable prices and delivered with incomparable service that is tailored to her customers' preferences.  Blanca is a very enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work and she is very determined; every day she gives her all to create a better life for herself.  She wants to make a new investment, but she does not have enough capital to support herself, so she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy clothing and cosmetics wholesale.  Blanca has good credit references and impeccable morals.  She promises that she will be able to repay her debt and she hopes this will bring her household financial security.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics wholesale

loans.name: Laguna De Cristal Group

texts.es: Formado por tres socias empresarias una de ellas es Dora casada, tiene dos hijos menores de edad, y su negocio es la comercialización de venta de ropa y cosméticos de la Avon desde hace 17 años, su necesidad de inversión es para la compra de cosméticos de la Avon como carteras de damas, cremas faciales, cremas  para el cuerpo, cremas para las manos, pinturas de labios, sombras, perfume de dama, colonias para caballeros etc. Ángela tiene 57 años y su negocio es la venta de frutas y verduras y Francisca tiene 56 años y su negocio es la venta de frutas también ambulante.
texts.en:
One of the women in this group of three partner entrepreneurs is Dora. She is married and has two children, who are still minors. She has been in the business of selling clothes and cosmetics from Avon for 17 years. She needs this investment so she can buy cosmetics from Avon, such as ladies' handbags, facial creams, body creams, hand creams, lipstick, eyeshadow, perfume for ladies, cologne for gentlemen, etc. 

Ángela is 57 years old and her business is selling fruits and vegetables. Francisca is 56 years old and her business is also selling fruits as a street vendor.

loans.use: to invest in buying Avon cosmetics like ladies' handbags, face, body, and hand creams, lipsticks, eye shadows, women's perfume and men's cologne, etc.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
Please meet 40-year-old David from Paynesville North in Liberia. Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County. The area is home to “round time marketers,” traders that travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county. As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia. 

He completed 12 grades and is married. He describes himself as a working person. 

David has a shop which sells shoes, sneakers, slippers, etc. He has been in business for seven years and works 10 hours per day at his business. With this loan, he will buy goods such as shoes, sneakers, slippers, etc. One of the greatest challenges that he faces is few goods in his shop. He transports his goods by bus. He started his business with money from his father. He is proud of his business because he makes more profit. His plan is to own a house.  

He thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy goods such as shoes, sneakers, slippers, etc.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Abdul. He is married and has two children, aged 6 and 3 years. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him as a sales assistant.  

In 2011, Abdul established his business: mobile phone credit voucher cards for different communications. He began his business because he wanted to help himself and his family by becoming self-employed. His business is located in the outskirts, and his main customers are the general public, men and women. 

Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about 1,000,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Abdul requires a loan in order to buy more credit voucher cards for resale. Abdul planned to open another shop to be managed by his wife to get more profit. He is now having another shop that is being managed by is wife, so Abdul’s dreams have come true by the help of the loan. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more credit cards and movies and to open another outlet

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol a sus 44 años de edad, se dedica desde su finca a trabajar la cría y levante de ganado lechero, cuenta con amplia experiencia ya que toda la vida ha vivido en el campo y su familia se ha dedicado a la ganadería y la agricultura. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de una vaca con la cual espera aumentar su producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos. Con lo anterior podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y sus condiciones económicas. Su mayor sueño es sacar adelante a su familia e ir aumentando su patrimonio.
texts.en: Forty-four-year-old Marisol works at her farm raising dairy cows.  She has a great deal of experience as she has spent her whole life in the country and her family has always worked in livestock and farming.  She is currently asking for a loan to buy a cow that she hopes will increase her milk production and improve her profits.  This will help her improve her family's quality of life and their financial situation.  Her greatest dream is to get her family ahead and to build on her patrimony.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
This is Betty from Liberia.  She lives in Paynesville North, which is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia.  Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County.  The area is home to “round time marketers”, traders that travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county.  As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distributes to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia.
Betty is 42, married with 3 children.  Her children are between the ages of 24 and 11. One child is currently living at home and is in school. Betty owns her own cook shop selling rice, fufu and soup along with soft drinks for the past two years. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase food ingredients such as bonnie fish, meat, pepper, rice, vita, oil etc as well as to renovate her cook shop.  
On average, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business. She started her business with help from her husband. She transports her merchandise by taxi. She cites less stock as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is the flow of customers. In the future, she would like to build a modern restaurant. She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients such as bonnie, meat, pepper, rice, vita, oil, etc.

loans.name: Marta Elizabeth

texts.es:
Marta tiene 44 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene un hijo. posee  7 años de experiencia  en la compra y venta de sandias, dicha actividad la aprendió con su compañero de vida antes solo realizaba los oficios domésticos en su casa. Ella se traslada hasta la ciudad  donde va a comprar la sandia y la  traslada  en un pequeño vehículo que tiene su compañero de vida.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más sandia, dado que es la época en que sale la cosecha de sandia y como son las primeras que están saliendo están caras y quiere surtir el negocio. Con la inversión, surtirá su negocio, satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y obtener mayores ingresos para su familia


Ella manifestó, que sus proyecciones a futuro son el instalar otro puesto de venta de sandias, mejorar su vehículo y brindar el estudio a su hija.
texts.en:
Marta is 44 years old. She is in a common-law marriage and has one child. She has seven years of experience buying and selling watermelons, a trade she learned with her life partner. Previously, she only carried out domestic chores in her house. She travels to the city where she goes to buy the watermelons, which she transports back in a small vehicle that her life partner has. 

The loan she is seeking from Fundación Campo is to buy more watermelons. This is the time of year that the harvest comes in and the first watermelons that are coming in are expensive, and she wants to stock her business. With this investment, she will stock her business, satisfy the needs of her customers, and obtain a greater income for her family. 

Marta states that her plans for the future include setting up another stall for selling watermelons, improving her vehicle, and giving her daughter the opportunity to study.

loans.use: to buy more watermelons.

loans.name: Mujeres Vicotriosas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado MUJERES VICTORIOSAS está en su ciclo número DÉCIMO SEXTO del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, es un grupo numeroso y que está poniendo mucho esfuerzo porque cada una salga adelante. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, con lo que sabrán la situación de cada una de ellas.
Una de  estas mujeres es la Sra. Luciana, quien con mucho esfuerzo y gracias a la venta de pescado que hace está saliendo adelante. Ella desde siempre ha trabajado, ya que es consciente de que es la única forma de crecer y ser alguien en la vida, su principal inspiración es su familia y por ellos lucha.
Solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de pescado para poder venderlo, y de esa forma seguir invirtiendo en su plan de negocios.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Victoriosas" group is on its 16th loan cycle as part of the women's committee programme, where everybody works and helps each other to get ahead.  This is a large group and everybody is putting in the effort so that each member can get ahead.  The members are undertaking the poverty elimination survey so that we can ascertain each member's circumstances.

One member of the group is Luciana who, with a lot of effort and thanks to her fish sales, is moving ahead in life.  Luciana has always worked as she is aware that this is the only way she can grow and "be someone".  Her biggest inspiration is her family and it is for them that she fights.  

Luciana is applying for this loan in order to buy fish to sell.  She can then continue to invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy fish for selling on.

loans.name: Las Tejedoras Group

texts.es:
Las Tejedoras es un grupo muy trabajador, tiene un numeroso número de integrantes, son 23 miembros que luchan por crecer y ayudar a su familia para poder darles todo aquello que ellos necesitan. Están con muchas ansias de ir mejorando en el emprendimiento de cada una.
La señora Flavia es la presidenta del comité mujeres las tejedoras, ella solicita su crédito para invertirlo en la compra de  hilos para elaborar ropas artesanales para su posterior venta. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos de ñanduti, el cual es un tejido típico y hermoso del Paraguay. Cuenta que está muy contenta con lo que hace, ya que con esto ayuda a su familia, y también promueve el amor al tejido típico del país, lo cual ayuda a que las personas valoren lo nuestro.
texts.en: Las Tejedoras (The Weavers) is a large group of 23 hard-working members who fight to grow their businesses and help their families so that they can have all that they need. They each have a strong desire to keep improving their businesses. Flavia is the president of the group of women weavers. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of threads to weave handmade clothes to later sell. She dedicates herself to weaving ñanduti, which is the traditional and beautiful flower prints common in Paraguay. Flavia says that she is very pleased with what she does because it helps her family and also promotes the love of traditional weaving in the country, helping people to value what is around them.

loans.use: to purchase threads to weave ñanduti (traditional flower prints).

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Blas está en su  ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están con mucho entusiasmo y ganas de aprender y capacitarse, vieron una gran oportunidad de progreso en el programa de comité, están haciendo también la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer la situación económica de cada una.
La Sra. Guillermina es una persona muy sacrificada, cuenta que ayuda a su familia por medio de su trabajo, que consiste en la venta de ropas de manera ambulante. Es gracias a la habilidad que ella tiene para las ventas, que está mejorando sus ingresos y también creciendo como microemprendedora.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de remeras, jeans, pantalones, camisas y demás prendas, con las que podrá seguir con sus ventas y ofrecer buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en: The San Blas group is in its first loan cycle. This group of women has a lot of enthusiasm and a desire to learn and grown. They saw a great opportunity for progress in the group program and are participating in the poverty survey to learn the financial situation of each member. Guillermina is a very selfless person. She says she helps her family through her work, which consists of selling clothing as a street vendor. Thanks to her sales ability, she is increasing her income as well as growing as a small businesswoman. She is requesting the loan to purchase T-shirts, jeans, pants, shirts and other clothes, with which she will be able to continue selling and offering a good variety to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase T-shirts, jeans, pants, shirts and other clothes.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 49 años de edad, es viuda, y vive sola en su casa propia. Nancy se dedica al alquiler de cuartos, los cuales están construidos en su casa. Empezó con esta actividad después de que su esposo falleciera. Al principio le fue difícil pero gracias a su fortaleza pudo salir adelante y ahora tiene un ingreso estable. Con los ingresos del alquiler espera mejorar la infraestructura de sus cuartos para mejorar sus ingresos y alquilarlos a un precio más alto. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, y está muy agradecida por el apoyo económico recibido ya que le dará el capital para implementar su negocio y además se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. El monto de S/.2500.00 lo invertirá en comprar ladrillos y cementos para mejorar la infraestructura de sus cuartos.
texts.en:
Nancy, 49, is a widow living alone in her own house.  Nancy works renting rooms that are built at her home.  She started this activity after her husband died.  At first it was difficult but thanks to her strength she was able to get ahead and now has stable income.  With the rental income she hopes to improve the infrastructure of the rooms in order to improve her income and rent them at a higher rate.

This is her first Kiva loan and she’s very grateful for the economic support received for it will give her the capital necessary to equip her business; she commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the amount of 2,500 soles to buy bricks and cement to improve the infrastructure of the rooms.

loans.use: to buy bricks and cement.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
This is Martha from Liberia.  She lives in Paynesville North, which is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia.  Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County.  The area is home to “round time marketers”, traders that travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county. As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia.

She is 39, and single with two children.  Her children ages are 12 and 7. They are currently living at home and are in school.  

Martha owns her own shop selling beer, Guinness, soft drinks, etc., for the past two years. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more drinks for her business. 
 
On average, she works from  7 am to 8 pm at her business. She started her business with help from her fiancee. She transports her merchandise by taxi. She cites lack of inventory as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is the flow of customers.  In the future, she would like to build a modern house.  

She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more drinks such as beer, Guinness, soft drinks, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Abdoul

texts.en:
This is Abdoul from Liberia. He lives in Paynesville North, which is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia. Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County. The area is home to “round time marketers”, traders that travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county.  As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distributes to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia.

He is 37 years old, married with three children. His children are between the ages of 13 and 4. They are currently living at home and in school. Abdoul owns his own provision shop selling rice, milk, flour, sugar, toothpaste, etc for the past seven years. He will use the loan proceeds to purchase rice, milk, flour, sugar, toothpaste, etc.  

On average, he works 7am to 8pm at his business. He started his business with help from his father who is a teacher. He transports his merchandise by taxi. He cites less stock as his biggest challenge. His favorite part of his business is the flow of customers.  In the future, he would like to build a modern house.  

He is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase rice, milk, flour, sugar, toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Maferreh

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Maferreh from Kambia Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is divorced with three children between the ages of 2 and 8 years. Two children are currently attending school.  

Maferreh runs a general store within her community where she sells soap, biscuits, "pure water" and slippers. She has been running this business since 2010. She works at the business every day, 11 hours per day. She says that the main challenges to her business are proper business location and insufficient capital to operate her business.

Maferreh has requested a loan in order to buy more soap, biscuits, "pure water" and slippers. The extra income from this loan will allow her to have a permanent business location and take good care of her family. In the future, she plans to build a house and send her children to university. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more soap, biscuits, "pure water" and slippers

loans.name: Miatta

texts.en: Miatta is 24 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which is the highest production rubber plantation in Liberia. She is single with two children, ages 5 and 1. They all live at home and only one is in school. Miatta was unable to attend school and, for four years now, she has been selling red oil (palm oil) around her community and market. She started this business with small goods from her friend as a "sell-pay" (take the goods on credit, sell the goods, pay the principle and have the profit). She learned this trade from her friends. She enjoys her business because she makes good profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil (palm oil) for her business. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil (palm oil) for her business.

loans.name: Roseann

texts.en:
This is Roseann from Liberia. She lives in Paynesville North, which is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia. Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County. The area is home to “round time marketers”, traders that travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county. As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distributes to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia.

She is 35, married with two children. Her children ages are 5 and 3. They are currently living at home and are in school. Roseann owns her own provision shop selling oil, sardines, rice, milk, flour, sugar, toothpaste, soap, etc., for the past seven years.  She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more inventory.

On average, she works from 7 am to 6 pm at her business. She started her business with help from her husband. She transports her merchandise by taxi.  She cites lack of inventory as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is the flow of customers. In the future, she would like to build a modern house.  

She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase oil, sardines, rice, milk, flour, sugar, toothpaste, soap, etc.

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
A citizen from Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Cheng is 47 years old and a mother of five children. The main source of income for her family is from edible arum on two hectares of land. Cheng has been engaged in her current business for 24 years. 

With this new loan, she is a second-time borrower with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). After the original loan that she has fully repaid, she has maintained a good living condition for her family and wants to build a decent house for her children. 

Now, she takes a new loan to buy good arum seedlings and fertilizer for the upcoming planting season. Moreover, she will spend a portion of the loan to dig a well and to buy a water pump for her cash-crop. She hopes to gain more income, so that she can keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy good arum seedlings and fertilizer for the upcoming planting season.

loans.name: Zaituna

texts.ru: Зайтуна добрая и усердная женщина в возрасте 37 лет. Она одна без мужа воспитывает двоих сыновей и сама обеспечивает семью. Последние два года Зайтуна занимается торговым бизнесом. У нее есть тоговая точка на рынке района, где она продает женскую и мужскую одежду. Ей в деятельности помогает ее старший сын. Зайтуна в месяц дважды закупает оптом свой товар и продает в своей точке по розничной цене. Зайтуне сейчас необходимо увеличить товарооборот.  С этой целью она просит кредит для приобретения сезонной женской и мужской одежды на продажу.
texts.en: Zaituna is a kind and hard-working woman, aged 37. She is a single mother with two sons. For the past two years, Zaituna has sold men's and women's clothing at the local market. Her oldest son helps her with the work. Zaituna buys clothing wholesale twice per month and sells it at a profit. Now it is time for Zaituna to restock her shop and she has asked for a loan to buy men's and women's clothing for the current season.

loans.use: to purchase men's and women's clothing for resale to increase her business

loans.name: Viviano

texts.es:
Viviano, de 48 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, además de ser amable y  cordial, es soltero, no tiene hijos. Viviano se dedica a la agricultura , cuenta con un terreno de 10 hectáreas, en donde siembra plátano, cacao y otros productos de su región, lleva en este negocio un poco más de 11 años y aveces contrata a trabajadores del lugar para que lo ayuden con sus cosechas. Le gusta su actividad pues le permite tener buenos ingresos con el cual puede solventar sus gastos, así como el sentirse ocupado y ser un próspero empresario. Este será su primer préstamo con Kiva, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles comprará abono orgánico para su producción de plátano, cacao y otros productos.
texts.en:
Viviano, age 48, is a hard-working, kind, courteous, and diligent man. He is single and has no children. Viviano works in agriculture. He has 10 hectares of land where he plants banana, cocoa, and other local products. He has had this business for a little over 11 years, and he sometimes hires local labourers to help him with the harvest. He enjoys his work because it allows him to have a good income with which to cover his costs. It also allows him to feel occupied and to be a prosperous businessman. This will be his first loan on Kiva, so he hopes for your collaboration so that he can continue with his goals. He promises to repay his quotas punctually.
With the requested 1500 nuevos soles, he will purchase organic fertilizer for his production of banana, cocoa, and other products.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Nelly Del

texts.es: Nelly de 44 años de edad  es madre soltera vive con sus dos hijos ellos estudian actualmente, Nelly tiene una tienda en su lugar de residencia desde hace 3 años tienen mucha clientela pues tiene varios productos como golosinas, granos básicos, azúcar, sopas, café, etc.  a la disposición del cliente, con las ganancias que obtiene logar cubrir algunos gastos de us hogar, Nelly esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas mercadería y surtir aun mas su negocio  para obtener mejores ganancias y poder tener una mejor estabilidad económica con sus hijos.
texts.en: Nelly, 44, is a single mother who lives with her two children. They are currently in school. Nelly has had a store in her home for three years. She has lots of customers. She has lots of goods like candies, basic grains, sugar, soups, cafe, etc. available for her customers. With the earnings, she can cover some household expenses. Nelly is asking for a loan to be able to buy more merchandise and stock her business more in order to get more profits and to able to have greater economic stability along with her children.

loans.use: to buy candies, basic grains, sugar, soups, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Rut Noemi

texts.es: Doña Rut de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo y adicional a esto vende verduras en el mercado que esta cerca de su casa, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y ha ganado experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno donde siembra esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que la prefieren porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y con un buen servicio; doña Rut desea realizar una nueva inversión que le permita aumentar la producción por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, insecticida, fertilizantes, herramientas, etc. doña rut tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Rut is 43 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and son. She works growing corn and sorghum. She also sells vegetables in the market near her home. She has been a farmer for several years and has gained valuable experience that allows her to obtain the best crops. Her farmland is located in a highly agricultural area and very close to her home. She sells her products in all the areas surrounding her community and has gained a large customer base. Her customers prefer her because everything she sells is top quality, her prices are affordable, and she provides good service. 

Rut wants to make a new investment so that she can increase production. That is why she is requesting a loan from Integral. She will use it to purchase corn seed, beans, insecticide, fertilizer, tools, etc. Rut has good credit references and assures us that she will be able to pay off her debt. She is also hopeful that she will bring financial security to her household.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, beans, insecticide, fertilizer, tools, etc.

loans.name: Brisas Del Xolotlan Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras  de éxito,una de ella  es Magela tiene 43 años de edad, casada, con cuatro  hijos , desde hace 12 años tiene su pulpería en su domicilio, tiene 8 años de ser cliente con la institución consecutiva quien ha demostrado ser responsable  en sus pagos en el crédito, sus hijas mayores le ayudan en la administración del negocio, su crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos como arroz, frijol, azúcar, aceite, pan, pan dulce, sal, jabón de lavar, jabón de baño, cloro, detergentes, carne de res, carne de pollo, productos lácteos, etc. con el crédito anterior logro que su negocio es más grande en cuanto a variedad de productos que no contaba en su negocio, Ana tiene 40 años de edad su negocio es la venta de ropa usada, Juana tiene 43 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y ropa usada.
texts.en:
This group consists of three successful, entrepreneurial women.  One of them is Magela.  Magela is 43 years old, married, and has four children.

Magela has been running a convenience store from her home for the past 12 years.  She has been a client of the institution for the last 8 years and has shown herself to be responsible when it comes to making her loan repayments.  Her older daughters help run the business.  Magela will invest her loan in buying grains such as rice; beans, sugar, oil, bread, sweet buns, salt, washing powder, bath soap, bleach, detergents, beef, chicken, dairy products etc.  She used her previous loan to expand her business by purchasing a range of products that she didn't already sell.  

Ana is 40 years old and has a business selling used clothing.  Juana is 43 years old and her business is selling both new and used clothing.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, beans, bread, sweet buns, salt, washing powder, bath soap, bleach, detergent, beef, chicken, milk products, etc.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Although she grew up in difficult circumstances, Rose is an entrepreneur. She owns a local chop bar in Hohoe. She has been involved in this enterprise for a while now. Rose is single without any children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her support herself and her extended family. Rose wants to use her loan to purchase more ingredients, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of her tasty local dishes. In the long term, Rose plans to reinvest future profits into her business so she can expand and meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of her tasty local dishes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase increased amounts of wood

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Please meet 29-year-old Mohammed, who resides in Paynesville South, a suburb just outside Monrovia. The area one of the most populated areas in Montserrado county with one of the best standards of living in the country. Good roads, access to clean water, affordable rents and plentiful transportation options make Paynesville South one of the most popular places to live.  

He did not go to school and he is married, and has two children ages 3 and months old. Only one is currently in school. He describes himself as a working person. 

Mohammed has a shop in which he sells rice by the bag, milk, flour, sugar, and other items. He has been in business for 7 years and works 13 hours per day at his business. With this loan, he will buy goods such as rice, flour, sugar, oil, milk, and other items. One of the greatest challenges that he faces is that he sometimes has few goods in his shop. He transports his goods by bus. He started his business with money from his father. He is proud of his business because he makes more profit. His plan is to own a house. He thanks you in advanced for your support!

loans.use: to buy goods such as rice, flour, sugar, oil, milk, and other items to resell.

loans.name: Arpu

texts.en:
Arpu is 27 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, located by the sea and the capital city of Grand Bassa County. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Arpu is living together with her fiancée. She did not go to school and has six children between 12 and 3 years old. They live at home and are in school. 

For the past ten years, she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She started this business with the little amount from her fiancée, and she learned this business from her friends. She likes her business because of the way people respond to it.

Arpu is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es: Doña esmeralda de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda mas surtida, las personas la prefieren y la mantienen delante de la competencia porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, como toda buena comerciante  quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Esmeralda, age 53, lives in her own home with her child. She has a store where she sells basic staples, beans, milk, eggs, bread, etc. She has had her business for many years, and this has given her experience in sales that allows her to make a better income. Her business is located in her home, in a high-traffic area; this has made her a lot of customers. Her store is more stocked and people prefer it. She stays ahead of the competition because she always has what her customers need, and sells high-quality products at accessible prices and with unrivalled service. She is always at her customers' beck and call. Like all good businesspeople, she wants to expand her business and make a new investment, but she needs capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy basic staples, candy, eggs, bread, drinks, etc. This way, she will be able to provide her family with better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy basic staples, candy, eggs, bread, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Pronia

texts.en: Pronia is a forty-one year-old married lady with three children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is agriculture, besides running a retail shop to boost her income.  Her vision is to educate her children to higher levels of learning, although she is facing a hardship of inadequate capital.  Pronia intends to use the loan to buy stock like sugar, rice and cooking oil to sell

loans.use: to buy stock like sugar, rice and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Saroen

texts.en: In her late 40's and a mother of eight children, Saroeun is a villager from Sa Ang district of Kandal province. Currently, five children are still in school. For her kids' sake, she grows beans on two hectares as the main source of income. She has been involved in the current business for ages. This is the first loan for Saroeun with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking to buy good bean seeds and to buy a water pump for her cash-crop. She hopes that she can make more income to keep her kids in school at least to grade 12 and to build a decent house for her family.

loans.use: To buy a water pump for her cash-crop

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёру 31 год. Он женат. У него трое детей. Старшей дочери 8 лет, сыну 6 лет, а младшей дочери 3 годика. Бахтиёр со своей семьей проживает в районе Хуросон. С ними также живут его родители и сестра. Бахтиер трудящийся человек и заботливый отец. Он и его жена работают в дехканском хозяйстве. В течение 6 лет Бахтиёр занимается земледелием. Он на большом земельном участке выращивает зерновые культуры. Первый урожай Бахтиёр уже собрал, теперь он собирается делать повторный посев. На сумму кредита он хочет приобрести семена кукурузы, бобовых и риса, а также топливо и минеральные удобрения. Он планирует получить хороший урожай и тем самым улучшить условия проживания. В дальнейшем Бахтиёр имеет цель расшириться и одновременно заняться животнводством.
texts.en: Bakhtiyor is 31 years old, married and has three children.  His oldest daughter is 8 years old, son is 6 years old and the youngest daughter is 3 years old.  Bakhtiyor and his family live in the Khuroson district.  His parents and sister also live with them.  Bakhtiyor is a hardworking person and a caring father.  He and his wife work at dekhan farm.  Bakhtiyor has been involved in farming for six years.  He grows cereal crops on a large land plot.  Bakhtiyor already gathered his first harvest and plans to do a second sowing.  He wants to use this loan to purchase corn, beans and rice seeds, and also fuel and mineral fertilizers.  He plans to get a good harvest and, thus, improve his living conditions.  In the future, Bakhtiyor has a goal of expanding and simultaneously get involved in animal husbandry.

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans and rice seeds, and also fuel and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 43 años, es madre soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres, acompañada de su hija. Vilma se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles siendo su casa su propio centro de trabajo. Cuando se divorció de su esposo le fue muy difícil crecer económicamente, pero gracias al apoyo de sus padres pudo afrontar su problema y salir adelante para mejorar su calidad de vida y ofrecer a su hija un mejor futuro ya que  ahora cuenta con un negocio estable. Como una mujer emprendedora Vilma espera sacar adelante su pequeño negocio y hacerlo crecer de tal manera que pueda abastecer a sus clientes ofreciéndoles un mejor producto. Esta es su primer crédito con Kiva, y está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan para seguir adelante. El dinero solicitado de S/.1500 lo invertirá en la compra de productos tales como azúcar, arroz, harinas, entre otros para así surtir su tienda y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Vilma is 43. She is a single mother and lives in her parents' home with her daughter. Vilma sells food products from her home. When she got divorced, it was very difficult for her to grow economically, but thanks to her parents' support she was able to confront this problem and get ahead to improve her quality of life and offer her daughter a better future; Vilma now has a stable business.
An enterprising woman, Vilma hopes to expand her small business so that she can supply her customers with a better product. This is her first loan on Kiva, and she is very grateful for the opportunity that you are offering her to move forward. She will invest the requested 1500 soles in the purchase of products such as sugar, rice, and flour to stock her store and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy products such as sugar, rice, and flour.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 35 years old, married, and has four children between six and 14 years old. He does a tailoring business in Nairobi town. He makes men's shirts, trousers and suits. He has been in this business for the past eight years making a monthly income of KES.10,000.  This has enabled him to provide for the needs of his family. 

This will be his sixth loan term from KADET LTD. and he plans to buy textile materials for sewing suits. He will also buy more sewing threads and buttons. He will use the generated profits to buy another sewing machine. He hopes to open another tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy  textile materials, threads and buttons

loans.name: Robia

texts.ru: Робиа трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 63 года. Она вдова, так как ее любимый муж умер, и она осталась без кормильца. Она имеет 2 детей. Она более 20 лет занимается купле продажей сельхоз продуктов, как семечка, кукуруза. Она торгует на местном рынке. Робиа очень общительная и знает, как вежливо обращаться с клиентами и поэтому в течение 20 лет она ведет своё дело. Учитывая спрос рынка, она планирует увеличить оборотный капитал. С такой целью она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки сельхоз продуктов. Она ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет ей улучшить условию проживания.
texts.en: Robia is a hardworking woman.  She is 63 years old.  She is a widow because her beloved husband passed away, and she was left without a provider.  She has two children.  She has been involved in buying and selling agricultural products, such as seeds and corn, for over 20 years.  She sells at a local market.  Robia treats her customers respectfully and this is why she has been running her business for 20 years.  Considering the market demand, she plans to increase her working capital.  With this goal in mind, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy agricultural products.  She awaits your kindness.  This loan will help her to improve living conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products and increase working capital

loans.name: Ederlinda

texts.en: Ederlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business. Ederlinda has been in this business for 27 years.  She earns additional income from raising pigs. Ederlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Adora

texts.en:
Adora is 36 years old and married, with four children.

Adora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like shampoo, eggs, soy sauce, and chips.

Adora has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming vegetables and mobile prepaid load.

Adora aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, eggs, soy sauce, and chips.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam trabaja diariamente en su tienda ubicada en su residencia. Tiene 55 años de edad y vela por el bienestar de sus cuatro hijos y esposo.  Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido -productos de la canasta familiar- para su negocio, con el fin ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor calidad en el servicio y mayor variedad de productos.  Espera que con dicha inversión pueda incrementar sus ventas y en un futuro cercano posicionar su negocio, consolidándolo en el sector.
texts.en: Miriam works every day in her store, located in her home. She is 55 and works hard for the well-being of her four children and her husband. She is now requesting a loan to invest in stock - basic household products - for her business. Her goal is to offer her clients better quality service and a greater variety of products. With this investment, she hopes to be able to increase her sales and to define her business in the future, consolidating it in the sector.

loans.use: to buy basic household products.

loans.name: Shohin

texts.ru: Шохину 41 год. Он женат и живет с женой, двумя сыновьями и двумя дочерьми в городе Душанбе. У Шохин высшее образование. Он по специальности инженер. Сейчас он хотел бы начать новую деятельность, чтобы улучшить условия проживания. Шохин собирается заняться предоставлением услуги такси. У него есть опыт вождения и он уже выбрал маршрутную линию, по которой он будет развозить пассажиров. Чтобы осуществить свое намерение Шохин просит кредит. Он на сумму кредита вместе суммой своего сбережения хочет купить автомобиль и начать деятельность. Шохин заранее благодарит всех за поддержку.
texts.en: Shohin is 41, married, and lives in Dushanbe with his wife, two sons, and two daughters. Shohin has a college education and is an engineer. Now he would like to start a new business to improve his living conditions and has decided to drive a taxi. He has experience driving and has already chosen a taxi route. Shohin has asked for a loan in order to accomplish his goal. He will use the loan along with his savings to buy a car and start driving passengers. Shohin thanks everyone for their support in advance.

loans.use: to buy a car and start a new business

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es: Franklin, de 23 años, es soltero y vive en la casa de su madre. Franklin se dedica a sembrar plantas de plátano, yuca, cacao los cuales son vendidos a una fabrica industrial cerca de sus terenos de cultivo, además tiene algunas cabezas  de ganado que cría desde hace 10 años, hasta el momento logro obtener muchas cosas desde el conocimiento necesario para tener mejores resultados y ser considerado como uno de los mejores agricultores de la ciudad. Le está yendo muy bien y tiene muy buenas ventas en su actividad por eso se está preparando para ampliar su negocio ya que es uno de los objetivos que se trazo desde hace mucho tiempo pero aun no lo puede hacer por que no tiene el capital suficiente. Por tanto éste será su primer crédito con Kiva y está muy agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Franklin, 23, is single living in his mother’s house.  Franklin works growing bananas, manioc and cocoa beans that are sold to an industrial plant near his fields.  He also owns a few heads of cattle that he’s raised for the last ten years.  To date, he’s managed to acquire many things ranging from the skills needed to get better results and being considered one of the best farmers in the city.  He’s doing very well and his sales are good which is why he’s preparing to expand the business since that’s a goal he set for himself some time ago but has been unable to reach so far due to insufficient capital.

This, then, will be his first Kiva loan and he’s very grateful for the financial support he gets to continue forward which is why he commits to make his payments punctually.  He will use the requested amount of 2,000 soles to buy organic manure to nourish his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 47 years old and married with ten children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Cecelia is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and other farm supplies.

Cecelia has been farming rice for 3 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

Tessie successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Tessie's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Sokhun's Group

texts.en: Sokhun is 43 years old, married, and has two children. Currently, both of them are still in school and rely on her. She earns a living through rice farming and growing soy beans, which she has been with for 20 years. Her husband works as a laborer to supplement the  family’s income. From the current business, she is able to earn about 28,900KHR per day and manages to save 8,300KHR after deducting daily expense. This is the first time for Sokhun has come to VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is seeking 1,000,000 KHR while other two members are seeking loan amounts of 1,200,000 KHR each. As the leader, Sokhun will spend her loan portion to buy rice and soy bean seeds and fertilizer for farmland. She hopes to make more income so that she can better her lifestyle and she can set aside some money to buy cows for raising.

loans.use: To buy rice and soy bean seeds and fertilizer for farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina es una mujer la cual tiene una edad de 42 años su familia por no tener una solvencia económica no pudo  estudiar solo curso el segundo grado de la primaria. Desde su infancia se ha dedicado a los oficios de ama de casa y al cultivo de café. Hoy es una mujer que formo un hogar en unión libre y en compañía de su pareja tienen 4 hijos la primera tiene 16 años es hembra cursa la secundaria, el segundo 14 años es varón cursa el tercer curso, el tercer hijo es varón tiene 9 años no estudia, cuarto hijo tiene 7 años. En compañía de su compañero de hogar y sus 2 hijos mayores se trasladan hasta sus cultivos de maíz y frijoles y elaboran lo que es: limpieza, abona, y corta de la cosecha. Las tierras que cultivan son obtenidas una parte por herencia y otra por esfuerzo propio, por eso a sus hijos les ha inculcado que valoren lo hacen para obtener una mejor vida. Ella tiene 12 años de dedicarse al cultivó propio ya que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia para adquirir lo básico y poder seguir adelante. Las tierras donde cultivan están a una distancia de 1.3 kilómetro de su casa de habitación por lo cual se trasladan a pie.

Actualmente está solicitando ayuda para compra de fertilizante y abono para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de maíz y frijol recién cultivado ya que esto fortalecerá aún más su producto.

Martina sueña con ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales para que puedan mejorar su vida económicamente mediante el estudio también sueña con obtener más tierras cultivadas de café para tener mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Martina is a 42-year-old woman.  As a result of her family not having financial solvency she was not able to study; she only completed the second grade of primary school.  Since her youth she has dedicated herself to housewife chores and growing coffee.  Today she is a woman who has formed a home in common-law marriage along with her partner.  They have four children; the first is a 16-year-old girl who attends secondary school, the second is a 14-year-old boy who attends his third course, the third is a 9-year old boy who does not attend school, and the fourth is a 7-year-old son.  

Along with her partner and two older children they move their crops of corn and beans, and they work by cleaning, fertilizing, and cutting the harvest.  The land that they farm was obtained in part by inheritance and in other part out of their own effort.  Because of this, they have instilled in their children the value of working hard in order to get a better life.  Martina has spent 12 years making a living through her own farming, which is the source of income for her family to get their basic needs and to be able to get ahead in life.  The land where they farm is a 1.3 kilometer distance from their home, and they get their on foot.

Right now she is asking for help to buy fertilizer and manure for the upkeep of her recently grown corn and bean crops.  This will strengthen her product even more.

Martina dreams of seeing her children become professionals so that they can improve their lives financially through school.  She also dreams of getting more land cultivated for coffee so that she gets a better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure for her corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es: Israel de 36 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años su principal siembra es el maíz y el frijol con las ganancias que obtiene logar solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, Israel esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de una lámpara ecológica ya que con las ganancias que obtiene no puede realizarlo ya que no cuenta con energía eléctrica estable y la lámpara será de mucha ayuda en su hogar.
texts.en:
Israel, 36, has worked in agriculture for several years; his main crops are corn and beans.  He uses profits earned to cover some of his household expenses.  He lives in his own house with his wife and four children.  

Israel is requesting a loan to buy an ecological lamp because he’s unable to do so with the profits he earns and he does not have stable electric power; the lamp will be of great help at home.

loans.use: to buy an ecological lamp.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
El señor Adrian es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposa y sus 5 hijos. Su negocio compra y venta de cerdos desde hace 20 años.
Don Adrian los cuales vende en su comunidad y en los caseríos cercanos a la misma.  Necesita el credito para la compra de más cerdos para  seguir realizando su negocio. 
Don Adrian espera que el préstamo la ayude mucho para desarrollar sus negocio, además desea que esta inversión le ayude a aumentar sus ventas y  gracias a esto poder mejorar un poco su estilo de vida y el de su familia.
Don Adrian espera en unos años hacer crecer sus negocio y que este sea uno de los más reconocido de su comunidad y  así seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.




Choluteca, Honduras – Mayo 2013
texts.en:
Adrian’s a very responsible, hardworking person living in a community in southern Honduras with his wife and five children.  His business for the last 20 years has been buying and selling pigs.  He sells them in his community and in nearby settlements.  He needs the loan to buy more pigs to stay in business.

Adrian hopes that the loan will help him much to develop his business and he also wants the investment to help him increase sales thanks to which his and his family’s lifestyle will improve a bit.

He hopes in a few years to make the business grow until it becomes one of the best known in the community so he can continue to support his children’s schooling so that they can have better life opportunities.

Choluteca, Honduras - May, 2013

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 59 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Violeta is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy additional pig and feeds.

Violeta has been pig fattening for 2 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut meat.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and feed

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Salvacion is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other fishing equipment.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment.

loans.name: Melda

texts.en:
Melda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 27000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Melda has been in this business for 5 years. Melda earns additional income from buying and selling nipa, woven palm mats used for house repair and construction.

Melda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Djiguiseme  I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe DJIGUISEME  I sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Fala Sounkoro un des villages de la commune de Massigui,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres  l’arachide, du riz et  un peu de mil. Elles sont à leur septième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, Aissa  la première  personne à droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 05 ha de riz et d’arachide.
