With his loan, Demur will open a grocery shop. He will purchase grocery stock and after opening a shop he will work hard to increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a grocery shop.

loans.name: Kumrije

texts.en:
Kumrije wants to thank all Kiva lenders for their support which helped her to buy a cow. She has been selling milk to neighboring dairy farms. She loves what she does and in this way she generates an income. She is very happy with this opportunity which made an improvement to her living conditions. Kumrije again requests a loan to add some more sheep and goats to her farm. She is hoping to grow her income since she will have goats and sheep which produce more expensive milk and cheese than from the milk of a cow. 

Kumrije hopes in the future to expand her farm more. Her goal is to offer a better education for her children. She wants to thank all Kiva lenders again for their second loan.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats.

loans.name: Blanca Flor

texts.es: Blanca de 35 años de edad vive  junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene 6 años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en sacos asi como muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarla en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; ella necesita invertir por eso le solicita un credito que le permita comprar semillas de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herbicida, etc. blanca tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Blanca, 35, lives with her husband and three children in their own house.  She grows corn and beans and has been working in agriculture for six years.  This has given her considerable experience enabling her to obtain better harvests.  At harvest time she stores the crop in sacks as shown in the photograph, then sells it throughout the community.  Because of her quality product, low prices and good service, Blanca has many customers.

In order to invest more in her business she is requesting a loan to buy corn and bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide, etc.  Blanca has a good credit record among her acquaintances.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time and trusts she can give her household more economic stability.

loans.use: To buy corn and bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Zamu

texts.en:
Zamu is married with ten children, four of whom go to school. Zamu also takes care of her sister.   

She has a business selling soft drinks, and she has been in this business for six years. Zamu has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more crates of soda, boxes of mineral water, oranges and mangoes for making juice and other packed juices.

Zamu generates additional income from tailoring. She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires of becoming a supplier of juices and also hopes to educate her children up to university. Zamu lives with her family in a house which has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying for electricity.

loans.use: to buy crates of soda, oranges, mangoes, boxes of mineral water and other packed juices to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is a 21-year-old youth client, who lives with his three brothers and his parents. Ali is a grocer, and takes part in providing the family income. He sells all the basic needs of a house, such as soft drinks, dairy products, canned food and detergents. He has been in this field since 2009 and has gained good experience. Ali has a good reputation in the neighborhood and has gained the respect of many people, thanks to him providing services for the surrounding areas.

Ali is requesting a youth loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to buy two new refrigerators, a motor generator and to increase his inventory. Ali believes that this loan will change his current financial conditions and will give him the chance to grow and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy two new refrigerators, a motor generator and to increase his inventory for his grocery store.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is a 51-year-old mother of two children, who are currently pursuing studies. For the last twelve years, Mariamu has earned a living from selling fresh juices to residents of Malindi, from which she earns a monthly profit of approximately 10,000 KES. 

Mariamu was introduced to Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) by a credit officer and she is applying for her fourth loan of KES. 20,000.This will help help her to purchase additional stocks of fresh fruits, empty plastic bottles, sugar and other items needed to expand her business.
 
Mariamu intends to use the profits from her business to pay for school fees for her children, provide basic needs for her family as well as expand the business. She hopes to own her own hotel in the future so as to help improve her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and other items needed to expand her business.

loans.name: Alfonce

texts.en:
Alfonce is 44 years old, married and has three children aged 17, 12 and 5 years old. He has a retail shop in Kangundo town and has run it for five years. 

This is his first loan term with KADET LTD, and he plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of sugar, maize flour, rice, cooking oils, milk and bar soap to sell. He anticipates to generate more income with which he will use to pay school fees for his children. 

He hopes to grow his business and open a wholesale shop and be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Fatima Estrella

texts.es: Fátima, es una joven soltera de 28 años de edad, quien es licenciada en Contabilidad y en la actualidad ejerce su profesión, pero tiene muchos deseos de superación por lo que se está preparando aun mas con la ayuda de su madre, ya que su salario es muy bajo para cubrir los gastos de estudios, el cual es una maestría en Contabilidad con énfasis en Auditoria, tiene toda la esperanza de que le permitirá abrir puertas para llevar a cabo sus pequeños proyectos personales referente a su carrera, por lo que  solicita el apoyo de crédito para poder pagar el curso de titulación de la maestría.
texts.en:
Fátima, 28, is a young woman with a degree in Accounting who currently works in her profession.  But she is very determined to go even further and wants to get more education with her mother's help, since her salary is not enough to cover education costs.  The degree she wants is a Masters in Accounting with a focus on Auditing.  Her hope is that this will open the doors to the small personal goals she has for her career.

She is requesting a loan to pay for the course work for her master's degree.

loans.use: To pay for education costs.

loans.name: Eleni

texts.es: Eleni tiene 58 años, es casada y vive en su casa propia junto a su familia. Eleni se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de catalogo. Hace poco se inscribió a una línea de lencería para su tienda, siempre con el objetivo de mejorar e incrementar sus ingresos económicos. Cuando su esposo cayó enfermo Eleni tuvo que buscar la manera de pagar los gastos de su hogar, pero con el apoyo de su familia pudo salir adelante y tener su propio trabajo. Espera seguir creciendo para poder ofrecer más productos y dinamizar sus ventas, incrementando su para mejorar sus ganancias. Este es el primer crédito con Kiva, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico recibido, el cual le ayudará a mejorar su negocio y a dinamizar sus ventas. Pues tendrá el capital para trabajar, por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Eleni, invertirá los S/. 1000 en la compra de cosméticos tales como labiales, perfumes, delineadores, etc. para tener un stock y mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Eleni, 58, is married and lives in her own house with her family.  She decided to sell cosmetics by catalogue and recently has signed up for a line of lingerie to sell at her store.  This is so she can increase her income.  When her husband fell ill, Eleni had to seek out a way to pay for household expenses.  With the support of her family she was able to get ahead and have her own job.

She hopes to continue expanding to offer more products and increase sales to improve her profits.  This is her first Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support which will help improve her business and boost sales.  Since she will have enough capital to continue working, she is committed to paying back the loan on time.  

Eleni will use the 1,000 PEN to buy cosmetics such as lipstick, perfumes, eyeliner, etc. to have more stock on hand and improve sales.

loans.use: To buy more products for her business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena, de 44 años, es una mujer buena y muy trabajadora, está casada con Fermín y tiene 03 hijos de  18, 15 y 02 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Elena consiste en la siembra de plátano, cacao, entre otros, tiene un terreno agrícola en donde cada temporada de siembra se va a preparar la tierra con abono orgánico y a limpiarla para poder regar las semillas, lleva haciendo este trabajo por 10 años y lo hace con la ayuda de algunas personas que contrata para estas fechas, cuando empezó a realizar este trabajo lo hacia en un terreno alquilado en donde casi toda la ganancia se iba en pagar al dueño de la tierra, pero con el tiempo pudo tener su propio terreno y ahora le esta yendo mucho mejor, vende su productos en la ciudad más cercana .Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que puede disponer de su tiempo y tener buenas ganancias por sus productos. Este será su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante por está razón se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 soles, comprará abono orgánico y semillas para empezar con la siembra de sus productos.
texts.en:
Elena, 44, is a kind, hard-working woman who is married to Fermín, and they have three children, ages 18, 15 and 2.  They all live together in their own house.  Elena grows bananas and cocoa, among other crops, on land that every planting season she treats with organic fertilizer and cleans in order to irrigate the fields.  She has been in business for ten years and hires workers to help out on specific dates.  When she began her farming activity she used to rent the land and most of her profit would go to the land owner.  But over time she was able to buy her own land and now things are going much better.  She sells her produce in the nearest city.

She really enjoys her work because she can schedule her own time and earn a good profit with her produce.  This is her first Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support.  This will help her continue prospering, and therefore she is committed to paying back the loan on time.

Elena will use the 1,000 PEN to buy organic fertilizer and seeds to start planting.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco de 48 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos,  es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra todos los años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son, maíz y frijol. Francisco desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Francisco, 48, is a very responsible man when it comes to his household obligations; and he has always been known for giving his family the best he can.  He lives with his wife and children and always works hard with cheerfulness and enthusiasm.  He is a farmer who plants basic grains every year, such as corn and beans.  Francisco wants to increase sales and decided to visit the INTEGRAL offices to request a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and other supplies.

He hopes to receive the loan because he has no other monetary income, so it will allow him to continue putting food on the table without limitation.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Su's Group

texts.en:
Su is 59 years old. She has two daughters who are married. She and her husband repair motorbikes and bicycles to earn a living. Her husband earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. She earns about 3,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total income is about 8,000,000 VND per month. They have done this job for five years. 

Her greatest business challenge is a lack of capital to invest in her business. Her dreams are to save money and to have good health. This loan is one of the steps that will help her attain these dreams. She will be able to invest in her business to gain earnings and save money. She is a hardworking woman. 

Su has participated in SEDA’s credit program since 2006. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,810,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. For this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to buy more motorbike and bicycle parts for her repair store. She’ll use the profits to buy more household equipment.

Other members who are part of Su’s group include the following: 
Thin is 60 years old. She has four children. She is a retired worker. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to breed pigs.
Ha is 37 years old. She has two children. She sells groceries. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to buy beer, beverages, biscuits and noodles for her grocery store. 
Hanh is 52 years old. She has three children. She sells groceries. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to buy beer for her grocery store.
Loi is 58 years old. She has two children. She is a retired worker. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to repair her house.
Ky is 55 years old. She has three children. She is a retired worker. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to breed pigs. 
Tu is 63 years old. She has six children. She is a retired worker. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her kindergarten.

loans.use: to buy more motorbike and bicycle parts for her repair store.

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
53-year-old Merab lives in the small village of Zeda Simoneti, which is in the Terjola district, with his 48-year-old wife Madona. Merab has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times to start a family business. However, he has not had any success. His loan request was rejected every time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The family has two milk cows and two pigs. The cows are milked every day to produce cheese and sell at the local market for a small income. From the pigs, they sell piglets. The family's total income is 280 GEL. This amount is rarely enough to buy food. 

Merab has requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Merab has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business loans with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. 

With his credit, Merab will purchase chicks and chicken feed. He already has cages in which to place them. Merab is a very hardworking man. He wants to expand his agricultural business and increase the family's income. He will raise the chicks and sell them at a higher price. The increased income will give them an opportunity to have access to a better living. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang was born in 1985. She has two children who are learning at a kindergarten school. She and her husband are workers to earn a living. Her husband earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. She earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total income is about 10,000,000 VND per month. They have done their jobs for six years. 

Aside from their day jobs, Trang also breeds chickens to earn more money. Her challenge is a lack of capital to invest in her business. Her dream is that her children will get a good education. This loan is one of the steps that will help her reach her dream. She will be able to invest in breeding chickens to gain earnings and save the profits for her children’s education. 

Trang is a hardworking and careful woman. She has participated in SEDA’s credit program since 2007. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,502,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy more chickens to raise on her farm.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to raise on her farm.

loans.name: Elsa Mirian

texts.es: Elsa de 33 años de edad es muy amable y trabajadora, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, Ella trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maiz y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad los comercializarla en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia. Elsa solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga y fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra, ella ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Thirty-three-year-old Elsa is very friendly and hard-working.  She lives with her husband and their two children.  She works very hard on her plot of land, where she grows corn and beans.  Her products are of very high quality and she sells them in the different markets near her home.  Elsa is applying to "Apoyo Integral" for a loan so that she will have the necessary money to invest in farming supplies.  She needs to buy insecticides, fertiliser, manure, seeds and more for her crops.  Elsa is longing to increase her sales in order to make higher profits and to give her family more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fertiliser, manure, seeds and more.

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is a 26-year-old man. He lives in Ibb, Yemen. He is the father of two children. 

Mustafa`s business is a grocery store and he sells gas cylinders, which he started doing one and a half years ago with limited capital. It is the main source of income for feeding his family. 

Though he has been working hard, he can`t meet his customers' requirements due to limited capital, as wholesalers require cash payment to provide him with grocery supplies. He has managed to attract more clients. He was happy about attracting new clients, but on the other hand, the financial challenge of meeting customers' demand is hindering his business progress and growth. 

So, he took out a loan of 160,000 YER, in order to purchase the grocery supplies that his shop needs.

loans.use: to purchase the grocery supplies that his shop needs.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a married Iraqi client, who is 49 years old and the father of three children. Abbas and one of his children take the responsibility of providing the family income, while the other two continue their education.

Abbas owns a small cafe. In his cafe, Abbas provides his clients with hot drinks like tea and coffee. This cafe is a well-known cafe in the neighborhood, since men usually gather around to arrange meetings or just to relax after a long day of work. Abbas established his business in 2012 and now he has one hired employee. 

Abbas is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD to pay the annual rent on his cafe. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so that he may provide his family with better living standards and continue educating his children.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent on his cafe

loans.name: Natividad De Jesus

texts.es: Doña natividad de 58 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 10 años siembra maiz y sorgo, con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es una mujer responsable,  honesta y trabajadora  vive con su esposo y sus dos  hijos. Doña natividad está solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. y poder mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra en la fotografía ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: 58-year-old Natividad has been farming for 10 years, growing corn and sorghum.  Through the sale of her harvested crops, she manages to cover her household expenses.  Natividad is a responsible, honest, hard-working woman who lives with her husband and two children.  She is requesting a loan to buy inputs for her crops such as fertilizers, compost, seeds, etc. so that she can improve the land she sows (the land shown in the photo).  She does not have enough money from what she earns to cover these expenses.  This investment will help her to make more income and improve her financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, seeds, etc. to improve her land

loans.name: Guiroutou3 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Guiroutou 3 fait partie de la coopérative Coopagui et est située à Guiroutou, un petit village au sud-ouest de la Côte d’Ivoire dans la région de San Pedro. Le groupe est composé de 10 personnes. 
Dramane a 50 ans. Il s’occupe de 20 personnes dans son foyer. Cela fait 3 ans qu’il fait partie de la coopérative Coopagui et il a 12.5 hectares de cacao certifiés UTZ et Rain Forest Alliance, ce qui veut dire qu’il respecte les principes et les normes de l’agriculture durable. 

Grace au crédit, il va pouvoir acheter des produits phytosanitaires pour sa plantation. Ces produits vont lui permettre d’augmenter sa production et ainsi d’accroître ses revenus. 

Avec l’argent supplémentaire, il va acheter une moto pour l'aider dans ses déplacement sur les pistes en terre menant à ses plantations.
texts.en:
The 'Guiroutou 3' group are part of the Coopagui cooperative and are located in Guiroutou: a small village in the south-west of  Côte dÍvoire, in San Pedro region.  The group has ten members.

Dramane is 50 years old and has 20 people in his household.  He has been a member of the Coopagui cooperative for three years and has 12.5 hectares of cacao which are UTZ and Rain Forest Alliance certified.  This means that he respects the principles and standards of sustainable agriculture.

With this loan, Dramane will be able to buy products which will improve the health of his crops.  These products will allow him to increase his production and thereby increase his income.

With any remaining money, Dramane will buy a motorcycle to help him travel over the dirt roads leading to his fields.

loans.use: to buy products to improve the health of his plants

loans.name: Guiroutou 4 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Guiroutou 4 fait partie de la coopérative Coopagui et est située à Guiroutou, un petit village au sud-ouest de la Côte d’Ivoire dans la région de San Pedro. Le groupe est composé de 12 personnes. 
Adama a 49 ans. Il s’occupe de 12 personnes dans son foyer. Cela fait 9 ans qu’il fait partie de la coopérative Coopagui et il a 7 hectares de cacao certifiés UTZ et Rain Forest Alliance, ce qui veut dire qu’il respecte les principes et les normes de l’agriculture durable. 

Grace au crédit, il va pouvoir acheter de l’engrais et des produits phytosanitaires pour sa plantation. Ces produits vont lui permettre d’augmenter sa production et ainsi d’accroître ses revenus. 

Avec l’argent supplémentaire, il souhaite pouvoir scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
The 'Guiroutou 4' group are part of the Coopagui cooperative and are located in Guiroutou: a small village in the south-west of Côte d'Ivoire, in San Pedro region.  The group has 12 members.

Adama is 49 years old and has 12 people in his household.  He has been a member of the Coopagui cooperative for nine years and has seven hectares of cacao which are UTZ and Rain Forest Alliance certified.  This means that he respects the principles and standards of sustainable agriculture.

Adama will use his loan to buy fertilizers and products for improving the health of his crops.  These products will allow him to increase his production and thereby increase his income.

Adama hopes to use the remaining money to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy products to improve the health of his crops

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña sonia de 45 años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos; ella se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y sorgo, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, ella comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, adicional a su trabajo en el campo también en su vivienda posee una pequeña tienda que le da ganancias extras para el mantenimiento del hogar; doña Sonia  es una mujer dedicada a su labor, luchadora siempre dispuesta a trabajar duro para alcanzar el éxito, quiere aprovechar el auge de su negocio para aumentar la producción y así poder tener mejores ganancias, necesita invertir en insumos pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, sorgo, abono, insecticida, herramienta, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía  para obtener mejores cosechas que le den buenas ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: 45-year-old Sonia lives with her life partner and their three children.  She is a farmer who grows corn and sorghum.  She has been in this line of work for many years and has gained very valuable experience which enables her to achieve the best harvests.  Sonia's farmland is located in an agricultural area.  She sells her produce in neighboring areas and has a lot of regular customers who like to buy from her because her produce is good quality, she sells it at really affordable prices and her customer service can't be beat.  In addition to her farm work, Sonia also has a small store in her home which provides her with extra income with which to support her household.  Sonia is a woman who is dedicated to her work.  She is always ready to work hard to achieve success.  She would like to make the most of the growth of her business to increase her production and thereby make more profits.  She needs to invest in inputs, for which she needs capital.  She is requesting a loan from Integral so that she can buy corn and sorghum seed, fertilizers, insecticides, tools, etc.  This will allow her to improve the land where she grows her crops (the land shown in the photo).  She will be able to achieve even better harvests which will give her good profits and enable her to improve her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, herbicides, etc. to improve her land

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is married with six children, two of whom go to school. She has a business, selling Irish potatoes and cassava. Irene has been in this business for 10 years. 

Irene has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from MCDTSACCO to purchase bags of sweet potatoes and cassava. 

Irene generates additional income by selling used clothes. She works at the market, seven days a week, on a retail basis. The major challenges to her business include transportation and seasonality. 

Irene aspires to own a delivery van, to use for transportation and to become a wholesaler. She lives in her own house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cassava and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with two children, one of whom attends school. She also takes care of her grandmother. 

Rose has had a business, selling charcoal, for eight years. She has applied for loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to purchase more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income from a grocery shop.  

Rose sells her products, on a retail basis, seven days a week. The major challenges facing her business include seasonality and theft. Rose aspires to be a wholesaler and to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Ursula Rosmery

texts.es:
Ursula tiene 35 años de edad, vive en la calidad ciudad de Pisco, la cual se ubica en la costa peruana y en la que se puede apreciar atractivos tturisticos muy bellos y sobre todo una gastronomía variada. Ursula es madre de 2 hijos, los cuales tienen 14 y 8 años, a los cuales ama muchísimo y por quienes cada dia lucha de manera incansable para poder ofrecerles una vida digna y sobre todo sean mejores que ella. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos Ursula solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Pediatría.

Día a día Ursula trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, con lo cual puede solventar a su familia y salir adelante, Ursula le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 9 horas; Ursula cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es amable con los clientes y siempre es atenta con ellos.

Ursula está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como arroz, azúcar, fideos, atun, entre otros insumos al por mayor, así podrá tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer en su negocio y podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Construir su vivienda y darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Ursula is 35 years old and lives in the city of Pisco, on Peru's coast.  There, tourists can enjoy a beautiful sights and, above all, a variety of local dishes.  Ursula is mother to two children, aged, fourteen and eight years old each.  She loves her children a lot and never stops fighting every day so that she can offer them a decent life and so that they can do better than her.  Due to a lack of money, Ursula was only able to finish up to the end of fifth grade at high school, but she would have liked to have studied to become a paediatrician.  

Each day Ursula works with her small business selling groceries.  This work allows her to cover household bills.  Ursula works around nine hours a day and thinks she is progressing because she is friendly with her customers and always tends to them.

Ursula is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy merchandise for her business.  She will buy rice, sugar, pasta, tuna and other supplies in bulk.  With this, she will have a greater variety of products to sell at her shop.  She will be able to increase her income and continue fighting in order to achieve her biggest dream: to build a home and give her children a good upbringing.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, pasta, tuna and more.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Victor vive en el distrito de Parcona, el cual es un distrito caracterizado por la amabilidad de sus pobladores y sobre todo porque su clima cálido. Victor debido a los pocos recursos económicos solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Mecánica.
Día a día Victor trabaja en su pequeño negocio de cerrajería, con lo cual puede solventar los gastos de su hogar y puede atender hasta 3 clientes en el dia, ya que  para poder preparar las puertas que construye demora un poco de tiempo de acuerdo al tamaño; él cree que está saliendo adelante con su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo realiza su trabajo con mucha responsabilidad.

Victor está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su gran apoyo el podrá mejorar su salud ya que debido a un accidente podrá costear su tratamiento dental ya que podrá confeccionar  su prótesis dental, así podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Victor lives in Parcona district.  This district is known for the friendliness of its people and, above all, for its hot climate.  As his family had limited financial resources, Victor was only able to study up to the fifth year of his secondary education.  However, he would have liked to have studied for a degree in mechanical engineering.

Victor works every day in his small metal shop which enables him to cover his household expenses.  He is able to serve up to three customers a day as it takes a while to prepare the doors that he makes according to their size.  He believes that he is making progress in his business because he is very friendly with his customers and, above all, he carries out his work very responsibly.

Victor is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their great support, he will be able to improve his health.  He will be able to pay for dental treatment that he needs because of an accident.  He will be able to have his false teeth made up and thereby enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to improve his oral health

loans.name: Nilton Yuri

texts.es:
Nilton vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad de clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, paprika, esparrago, entre otros. Nilton vive al lado de su esposa con quien tiene un hijo de 18 años de edad, por el cual el y su pareja trabajan cada día para poder darle una vida digna y mejores oportunidades que las que Nilton tuvo, ya que debido a sus pocos recursos económicos solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto de secundaria, pero le hubiera encantado estudiar la carrera de computación e informática.

Dia a día nilton trabaja como vigilante para una pequeña empresa de seguridad, con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar con mucho esfuerzo los gastos de su hogar, Nilton trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al dia y cree que esta saliendo adelante con su trabajo porque es muy responsable.

Nilton esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una refrigeradora para su vivienda ya que actualmente no tiene donde poder guardar sus alimentos , de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad  su mas grande sueño:” “Tener su casa propia y poder darle una profesión a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Nilton lives in the city of  Ica. It has a warm and pleasing climate. He works in agriculture, especially in growing cotton, paprika, asparagus and more. Nilton lives with his wife, with whom he has an 18 year old son, for whom he and his wife work to give him a dignified life and better opportunities that Nilton had. Because of his low income, he was only able to go to school up to the fifth year of secondary school, but he would have loved to study computer and information technology. 

Day to day, Nilton works as a guard at a small security company. With the income from his work he is able, with a lot of effort, to pay for the household expenses. Nilton works around 9 hours a day and he thinks that he is getting ahead with his work because he is very responsible.  

Nilton is very grateful to the lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to buy a refrigerator for his house, since right now he doesn't have a place to keep his food. This way, he can improve his quality of life and keep fighting to make his biggest dream come true: owning his own house and giving his son a profession.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Gamaliel

texts.es: Don gamaliel de 56 años de edad  vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres  hijos, el posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, elabora puertas, balcones, rejas entre otros, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este negocio y tiene mucha experiencia que le ayuda a mejorar cada día su labor, hasta ahora el negocio le ha dado muy buenos resultados ya se hizo de mucha clientela pues lo buscan por la calidad de su trabajo, por los precios accesibles pero sobre todo porque siempre realiza el trabajo al gusto del cliente; don gamaliel es un hombre muy trabajador, honesto y sobre todo humilde, siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan superarse y llegar al éxito; quiere hacer crecer el negocio pero necesita de capital para compra de material por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar, hierro, metal, herramienta etc. y asi poder  llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: 56-year-old Gamaliel lives with his life partner and their three children.  He owns a metal shop where he makes doors, balconies, railings and other products.  He has been in this business for a number of years and has a lot of experience which helps him to improve his work every day.    Up to now, his business has given him very good results and he has a lot of customers who seek him out because of the quality of his work, his affordable prices but, above all, because he always does his work to suit his customers' tastes.  Gamaliel is a very hard-working, honest, humble man who is always looking for new opportunities to improve himself and achieve success.  He would like to grow his business but needs capital to buy materials.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Integral to buy iron, metal, tools, etc.  This will enable him to provide his household with financial security.

loans.use: to buy iron, metal, tools, etc.

loans.name: Thuy's Group

texts.en:
Thuy was born in 1974. She has a little child. Her husband works as a cameraman to earn a living. He earns about 5,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) per month. 

Thuy is a tailor. Her main job is sewing uniforms for schools. She earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. Thuy has done this job for eight years. Her family’s total income is about 10,000,000 VND per month. Thuy also breeds chickens to earn more money. 

Thuy has a lack of capital to invest in her business. Her dream is to open a sewing shop. This loan helps Thuy take one step towards reaching her reach that dream. The loan helps her buy more sewing machines to expand her business. This will increase her earnings and help her to save profits, which she can use to open her sewing shop. Thuy is a hardworking and careful woman. 

Thuy has participated in SEDA’s microfinance program since 2011. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 6,322,000 VND and repaid it on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 7,630,000 VND to buy more sewing machines.

Other members who are part of Thuy’s group include the following:
- Đieu is 61-years-old. She has two children. She is a retired worker. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to invest in sewing gloves.
- Nga is 33-years-old. She has two children. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to breed chickens.
- Khuyen is 33-years-old. She has two children. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to sell votive objects.
- Nhien is 43-years-old. She has three children. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to sell fruits.
- Tho is 26-years-old. She has a child. She sells groceries. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to sell medicine.

loans.use: to buy more sewing machines.

loans.name: Rubi

texts.es: Rubí tiene 25 años, es casada  y vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y su única hija. Rubí se dedica a la agricultura, y sus productos principales son el maíz, plátano, y cacao. Vende sus productos en el mercado de la ciudad y gracias a esta actividad ha podido  mejorar su calidad de vida y el de su familia. Al principio fue difícil, pero gracias a su esfuerzo y al de su esposo pudo salir adelante e iniciar con su nuevo proyecto, espera que le vaya todo bien y empiece a crecer e incrementar sus ganancias, para así también mejorar los cultivos de sus terrenos. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico recibido, que le dará el capital para mejorar su negocio y la producción de sus cultivos. Promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, para más adelante seguir trabajando con su banco comunal. El monto de S/.1300.00 lo invertirá en la compra de abono orgánico para aumentar la producción del cacao.
texts.en:
Rubí is twenty-five years old, is married, and lives in her own home together with her husband and their only daughter.  Rubí makes a living in agriculture, and her main products are corn, bananas, and cocoa.  She sells these products at the market in the city and, thanks to this activity, has been able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.  At first, this was difficult, but thanks to the efforts of both her and her husband, she was able to get ahead and begin her new project.  She hopes that everything goes well and that her income begins to increase.  She wants to improve her lands' crops.

This is her first loan with Kiva.  She is thankful for the economic support she has received.  She will receive capital in order to improve her business and crop production.  She promises to be punctual with her payments so that she can continue working with the communal bank.  She will invest the S/.1300.00 in the purchase of organic fertilizer to increase cocoa production.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer in order to increase crop production.

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira is 52-years-old and is the mother of two children, who are currently studying. For the last 10 years, Munira has earned a living by renting rooms in Malindi. Her monthly profit adds to 15,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). 

Munira was introduced to Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) by a credit officer and she is now applying for her fourth loan of 40,000 KES to repair and paint her rental rooms, so as to better her business. 

Munira will use the profit from the business to pay school fees, purchase food for her family and expand her current business. In the future, Munira also hopes to expand her business by owning several rental houses, hence, improving her family's financial stability.

loans.use: To renovate her rental houses

loans.name: Jimmy Pool

texts.es:
Jimmy tiene 34 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad ubicada en la costa peruana, la cual se caracteriza por su gastronómica variada, sus hermosas playas y sobre todo por sus lindos atractivos turísticos. Jimmy es un hombre muy trabajador y sobre todo con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que cada día trabaja como jardinero, y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar con mucho esfuerzo;  Jimmy cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y siempre es cumplido con los clientes.

Jimmy esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales de construcción como ladrillos, arena, hormigón, entre otros, de esta manera podrá mejorar la vivienda de sus padres ya que las paredes están rajadas, de esta manera mejorara su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y seguir apoyando a su familia”.
texts.en:
Jimmy is 34 years old. He lives in the city of Pisco,  a city located on the Peruvian coast. It is known for its varied cuisine, its beautiful beaches, and above all its tourist attractions. Jimmy is a very hardworking man who above all really wants to get ahead. That is why he works every day as a gardener, and with the income from his job he is able, with much effort, to pay for his household expenses. Jimmy believes that he is getting ahead because he is very responsible and he is always reliable with the customers.

Jimmy is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have given he will be able to buy construction materials such as bricks, sand, concrete, and more. This way, he will be able to improve his parents' house, since the walls are cracked. This will improve his quality of life, and he will keep fighting to be able to make his biggest dream come true: own his own home and keep helping his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Wendy Luisa

texts.es:
Wendy es una joven de carisma contagiante, vive en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por su clima cálido y acogedor, Wendy vive al lado de sus padres a quienes quiere muchísimo y por los cuales cada día se esfuerza para que se sientan orgullosos de ella, ya que a pesar de las adversidades por las cuales ha pasado aun sigue adelante, Wendy tiene 23 años y a pesar de su juventud es muy responsable ya que día a día trabaja como empleada en una empresa de seguridad y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de estudios, ya que actualmente cursa la carrera de administración y va cursando el noveno ciclo de la carrera, Wendy cree que le está yendo bien porque es muy responsable y sobre todo tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Wendy está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá pagar un ciclo completo en la universidad, con lo cual podrá asistir sin problemas a sus clases y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Ser una gran profesional y poder tener su caja propia y apoyar a su familia”.
texts.en:
Wendy is a young woman with a contagious charisma.  She lives in the city of Ica, which is characterized by its warm climate and friendliness.  Wendy lives with her parents, whom she loves very much.  She makes an effort every day so that they will feel proud of her.  Despite the adversities that they have faced, she continues to move forward.

Wendy is twenty-three years old and despite her youth, is very responsible.  Day to day she works as an employee at a security company.  With the fruit of her labor, she can cover her school expenses.  Presently, she is studying for a career in management, and is in her ninth semester.  Wendy believes that her studies are going well because she is very responsible and above all, she has a lot of drive to move herself ahead.

Wendy is very thankful for the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the support that they have offered her, she will be able to pay for an entire semester of study at the university.  She will be able to attend her classes without any problems and continue fighting to make her greatest dream come true: "to be a great professional, to be able to have her own home, and to support her family."

loans.use: to pay for a semester of university studies.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Don Carlos de 65 años de edad se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace 25 años su principal siembra es el maíz y el frijol también se dedica a la corta de café, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don Carlos vive en casa propia con su familia, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de los insumos necesarios para su cosecha como: abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, herbicidas, etc. para obtener mejores cosechas y poder darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Don Carlos, 65 years old, has worked in agriculture for 25 years.  His main crops are corn and beans.  He also works cutting coffee.  With the earnings that he obtains from his sales he manages to cover some of the household expenses.  Carlos lives in his own house with his family.  

He is requesting a loan to purchase the necessary supplies for his harvest such as: manure, fertilizer, seeds, herbicides, etc., in order to obtain better harvests and to be able to give his family better financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizer, seeds, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años su principal siembra es el maíz y sorgo sus cosechas las vende en los comercios que están cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, el cliente vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, es esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc. para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
The borrower has earned a living in agriculture for several years. His main crops are corn and sorghum. He sells his harvests in stores that are near his place of residence. With the earnings he manages to cover his household expenses. The borrower lives in his own house with his life partner. 

He is requesting the loan to purchase manure, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, etc. This will increase his earnings and give him and his family greater economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase manure, herbicides, fertilizers, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Shota

texts.en:
Shota is 30 years old. He lives in Akhaltsikhe District, Minadze Village with his 25-year-old wife, parents, retired grandmother and 3-year-old daughter. Shota has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up without any success. His loan requests are rejected all the time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

This family has two milk cows, calves and a plot of agricultural land. On the land, potatoes, onions and different types of vegetables are grown. The cows are milked every day to produce dairy products. The harvested products and dairy are sold at the local market so the family can make a small monthly income. Their additional income is from Shota’s mother’s monthly salary and his grandmother’s monthly pension.

Shota requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Shota has been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With his credit, Shota will purchase a minibus. He wants to start trading fruits and vegetables. With the mini-bus, Shota will be able to purchase products at a wholesale price and distribute them among the villagers and at the local markets with a price markup. Shota will work as hard as he can and earn a good profit. He wants to use part of the profit for reinvesting in his agricultural business in order to expand it. This new business initiative, financed with a Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase a minibus for trading fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Nura

texts.en:
Nura is a 33-year-old widow with four children and currently lives in Kasese,Uganda.

She deals in the cosmetics business and also gets money from rental houses that her late husband left for her.

Good mother that she is, her desire is to educate her children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification, while her business plan is to trade wholesale. 

Nura is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Mithak

texts.en:
Mithak is a 33-year-old Iraqi client, who is married and has two children. He works hard to provide for them all by himself. Mithak owns a blacksmith's shop. In his workplace, Mithak fixes damaged body parts of cars. He is well-known in his area, since he not only fixes damaged body parts of cars, but also provides general blacksmith's services. He is a very talented person. He established his business in 2006 and grew with fame and experience.

Mithak is requesting a loan of $3,000 US to pay the annual rent for his blacksmith's shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he can continue providing the best for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his blacksmith's shop

loans.name: Masitula

texts.en:
Masitula is married with four children and all her children go to school. She doesn't take care of additional family members. 

She has a business selling new and used clothes. She has applied for a loan of 1,300,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of clothes. She generates additional income from a canteen. She moves door to door selling on a retail basis. She has been in this business for three years. 

Her major business challenges include transportation and a rainy season, which hinders her movements. She is aspiring to get permanent business premises and also to own a delivery van to ease transportation.   

She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying for electricity.

loans.use: To buy more bales of new and used clothes .

loans.name: Kelly Goselyn

texts.es:
Kelly es una joven e 20 años de edad, vive en el distrito de tate, ubicado en la ciudad de Ica, Perú y se caracteriza por su campos de cultivo y porque se encuentran muchos restaurantes turísticos, Kelly es una joven de condición humilde, por ello trabaja como obrera en un fundo  agrícola de la ciudad, y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de sus estudios, ya que actualmente está estudiando la carrera de enfermería técnica. Kelly trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y ella cree que está saliendo adelante porque quiere apoyar a su familia y convertirse en una profesional.

Kelly está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar un modulo de madera para que su familia pueda tener una casa donde vivir ya que actualmente su vivienda de adobe se encuentra resquebrajada, así ella podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y seguir luchando para convertirse en una gran enfermera.
texts.en:
Kelly is a young woman, 20 years old.  She lives in the district of Tate, located in the city of Ica, Perú which is characterized by its crop fields and its many tourist restaurants.  Kelly is a young woman of humble circumstances and so she works as a laborer on an agricultural farm of the city.  With the fruit of her labor she is able to cover the costs of her studies as she is currently studying for a career in technical nursing.  Kelly works around 8 hours a day and she believes that she is moving forward because she wants to support her family and become a professional.

Kelly is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help that they have offered her she will be able to buy a wooden unit so that her family can have a house to live in since currently her adobe home is cracked.  In this way she will be able to have a better quality of life and continue striving to become a great nurse.

loans.use: to purchase a housing unit.

loans.name: Chrim's Group

texts.en:
Chrim is a 32-year-old married mother of four children, three of whom are dependents and still in school. Her family lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. 

To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for 22 years and supplement their family’s income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns them about 21,000 KHR per day. 

Chrim has been with VisionFund for two cycles. She completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her support her family better with enough food. Now she is leading her group to ask for another loan. Chrim, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield, so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Jose Victor

texts.es: Don jose de 58 años de edad desde hace varios años se dedica a cultivar la tierra.  Con mucha dedicación cultiva maíz y frijol, lo cual le permite llevar el  pan de cada día a su hogar. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honrado y responsable. Habita junto a su  grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposa y sus dos hijos. Junto a su esposa trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia y darles mejores condiciones a las que ellos han tenido. Gracias a los conocimientos en la agricultura es como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar, dado que es la única forma que conoce para ganarse la vida honradamente.  Con muchos deseos de superación se acerco a esta institución para solicitar crédito ya que necesita invertir en la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc. para la siembra. Confía en Dios y en su trabajo que de esta forma logrará  tener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá acceder a una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Fifty-eight year old Jose has earned a living in agriculture for several years. He cultivates corn and beans and his dedication enables him to provide his family with daily sustenance. He is a hard-working, honest and responsible man. He lives with his family which consists of his wife and their two children. He and his wife both work very hard to get their family ahead and to provide better living conditions than they had previously.  

Thanks to his expertise in agriculture he manages to provide his home with sustenance. This is the only way that he knows how to earn an honest living.  

With a great desire for improvement, he turned to Kiva to request a loan because he needs to invest in the purchase of necessary agricultural supplies like: seeds, manure, insecticides, etc. for planting. 

He trusts in God and in his work that with these supplies he will manage to produce an abundant harvest, allowing him and his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Lorena Del Carmen

texts.es: Lorena de 34 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz y maicillo. Se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante 14 años de su vida y es así como se gana el pan de cada día. Ella es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y muy conocida en la zona por su enorme corazón y amabilidad para con los demás. Debido a que ya es temporada de siembra tomo la decisión de comenzar a prepararse. Es por esa razón que ha decidido solicitar este nuevo crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc. Lo que más desea es que su cosecha sea abundante y mejor que las anteriores, ya que esta es la forma en que ella consigue el sustento para su familia.  Confía en Dios que con su ayuda, su dedicación y empeño en el  trabajo lograra el sueño de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Lorena is 34 years old and works in agriculture, growing corn and sorghum. She has done this activity for 14 years and this is how she makes a living. She is a hard-working, responsible woman who is well-known in the region for her good heart and kindness to others. As this is the sowing season, she has made the decision to start preparing. This is why she decided to request this new loan from Integral to invest in buying seeds, compost, insecticides, etc.

Her biggest dream is for her harvest to be abundant and better than previous ones, since this is how she supports her family. She trusts in God because with his help, dedication and effort she will achieve her dream of improving her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizer, seeds, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael lives in the Litein area of Kenya. She has six children and has been doing this work for 15 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs and tea.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Mixed farming." Her biggest challenge is low prices. An animal on the farm has been given the name of Lelkina.

Rael was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Because of [the] grace period." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "It gives loans to poor farmers."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Rael replied, "Will provide more income to meet family needs."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Rael owns the following: cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy one big sack of cassava, two sacks of coco-yam and plantain and sell to customers.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is a 55-year-old woman. She is married to Gerald and a mother of five children. 

She does dairy farming and also small scale farming. She has been in this business for 10 years now and gets a monthly income of 50,000 Shillings.

This will be Penina's fifth loan with KADET LTD, she wants to buy a dairy cow and fertilizer for her crops. 

In the future, she wants to be a successful dairy farmer.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es: Eugenia tiene 30 años, está casada y vive en una casa alquilada, con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Eugenia se dedica a la agricultura, y siembra cultivos de maíz, cacao, plátano, etc. Con la experiencia que tiene en esta actividad y buscando obtener otros ingresos, Eugenia también tiene sembríos de plátano, fréjol y  yuca en la huerta de su casa, mediante esta actividad ha podido recibir buenos ingresos económicos el cual le permite tener una mejor calidad de vida. Gracias a su esfuerzo pudieron salir adelante, y conseguir una mejor producción. Lo que ahora espera es que le vaya bien con su cosecha de maíz, y que pueda vender todo su producto y obtener buenos ingresos para que inicie una nueva campaña. Esta es la primera vez que obtiene un préstamo con Kiva, y agradece el apoyo económico que se le brinda, prometiendo pagar sus cuotas al día.  El monto de S/.500.00, lo invertirá para comprar abono orgánico para la producción de maíz.
texts.en: Eugenia is 30 years old, married and lives in a rented house with her husband and two children.  Eugenia makes a living in farming, growing corn, cocoa, bananas and more.  With her experience in this work and because she is looking to increase her income, Eugenia also has bananas, beans and yucca growing in the vegetable garden at her house.  Through this work she has managed to earn a good income which affords her a higher quality of living.  Thanks to her efforts, she has gotten ahead and improved production.  She now hopes that her corn harvest will turn out well and that she can sell it all.  This would provide her with good earnings to start another season of growing.  This is Eugenia's first loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support.  She promises to make her daily repayments.  Eugenia will invest this loan in buy organic manure for growing corn.

loans.use: to buy organic manure for growing corn.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has five children and has been doing this work for 16 years. His primary income sources are milk and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Farming." His biggest challenge is insufficient funds. An animal on the farm has been given the name of Moita.

Joel was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, "Because of fast loan processing." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "It gives loans to poor farmers."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Joel replied that it will boost the family income.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Joel owns the following: cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To construct a zero-grazing unit.

loans.name: Rosario De La Cruz

texts.es: Rosario es una microempresaria de éxito, casada, con dos hijos  su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva, cosméticos de la Avon. Tiene 12 años de tener su negocio. Los artículos los vende a la comunidad, y público en general. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa como pantalón de varón, pantalón de dama, cosméticos de la Avon como perfumen de varón, perfume de dama, delineadores, pinturas de uñas, pinturas de labios, cremas para manos, cremas faciales, cremas para cuerpo etc.
texts.en: Rosario is a successful microentrepreneur, and is married with two children. She has a business selling new clothing and Avon cosmetics. She sells her products locally and to the general public. She will invest this loan in buying clothing such as mens' trousers, womens' trousers, Avon cosmetics, aftershave, perfume, eyeliners, nail varnish, lipstick, hand, face and body cream, etc.

loans.use: to invest in buying clothing such as mens' trousers, womens' trousers, Avon cosmetics, aftershave, perfume, eyeliners, nail varnish, lipstick, hand, face and body cream, etc.

loans.name: Arzaq/mhariq Group

texts.en:
This group is called Arzaq/Mhariq and consists of four women. They live in Aden, Yemen. Thoria is a happy woman who treats everyone well because of her opportunities to get ahead. She, like many people, has had good times and has gotten ahead despite whatever stands in her way. She is 25 years old, married and has one child. 

She is worried about her house, so she applied for a loan of 60,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB to buy construction supplies to remodel the inside of the house, and thus, make it more comfortable for her family. With great strength and dedication, she has become a better person.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to remodel the inside of the house.

loans.name: Dy's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Dy is aged 41 years and married. She and her husband have two children. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and planting cassava and cucumber, and they have been in this business for almost 21 years. With her current business, she is able to earn approximately 26,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day to support her family. 

This is the second loan for Dy with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. Dy fully repaid the past loan, which has helped her better support her family with enough foods. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Dy wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more crop yield and sell it for a good price, so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es: Luis es un empresario de éxito hombre casado, con tres hijos ya adultos, tiene 56 años de edad y su negocio es la venta y compra de chatarra desde hace 16 años. Con el crédito va invertirlo en la compra de chatarras, y realizarle unas pequeñas mejoras a su vehículo como mantenimiento compra de llantas, pintura, accesorios etc.
texts.en:
Luis is a successful businessman, married with three children who are already adults, and he is 56 years old.  For 16 years, his business has been the sale and purchase of scrap metal.  

With the loan, he will invest in the purchase of scrap metal and make some small improvements to his vehicle through maintenance by purchasing tires, paint, accessories, etc.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal, and to provide maintenance to his vehicle by purchasing tires, paint, accessories, etc.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan tiene 32 años de edad, es padre de un pequeño de 2 años de edad, al cual quiere muchísimo y sobre todo porque quiere brindarle mejores oportunidades que la que el tubo. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos él solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de administración.
Día a día Juan trabaja como agente de seguridad, y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar, Juan trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día, y cree que está saliendo adelante en su trabajo porque es muy responsable.

Juan esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mercadería  arroz, aceite por galones, fideos, entre otros, para poder apoyar a su madre en iniciar un negocio de venta de abarrotes, con lo cual tendrá un ingreso extra y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener un gran bazar y apoyar a su familia”.
texts.en:
Juan is 32 years old.  He is the father of a 2-year-old boy who he loves to pieces.  He would like to provide his son with better opportunities than the ones he had himself.  Owing to his family's lack of money, Juan was only able to study up to the fifth year of his secondary education.  However, he would have liked to have studied for a management degree.

Juan works every day as a security guard.  Through his work he is able to cover his household expenses.  He works around 9 hours a day and believes that he is doing well in his work because he is very responsible.

Juan is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he will be able to buy merchandise such as rice, oil by the gallon, noodles, etc. and thereby support his mom in setting up a business selling groceries.  This will make the family an extra income and Juan will be able to continue working hard to realize his biggest dream: to own a large general store and support his family.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil by the gallon, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 300 laying hens and chicken feed.

loans.name: José Silvio

texts.es:
José tiene 33 años de edad, esta acompañado. Desde temprana edad he trabajado la tierra el cual lo aprendí ayudando a su familia a cultivar la tierra. Actualmente, se dedica a manejar una mototaxi en la ciudad que esta a 30 minutos de su lugar de residencia.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar abonos y fertilizantes  para que su cultivo crezca bien y tenga una buena cosecha; ya que el trabajo en la mototaxi es un ingreso extra para su hogar,  pero no le alcanza para invertirlo en la agricultura. La necesidad es grande ya que no dispone del dinero necesario para invertirlo en la siembra y es un trabajo del cual obtiene buenos ingresos. Su propósito es, comprar más mototaxi, sembrar más cantidad de terreno y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 33 years old. He is in a common law marriage. Since he was young he has worked the land, which he learned helping his family do the same. Right now, he drives a motorcycle taxi in the city, which is 30 minutes from his residence.  

The loan he is asking for is to buy fertilizer so that his crop will grow well and have a good harvest. His work in the motor cycle taxi is extra income for his home, but it isn't enough to invest it in farming. The need is great since he doesn't have the necessary income to invest in planting and it is work that brings in good income. His objective is to buy another motorcycle taxi, plant more on his land, and improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer so his crop will grow well and have a good harvest. His income as a motorcycle taxi driver is extra income for his home, but not enough to invest in the farming.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor tiene 31 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos hijos. Vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos. Ellos se dedican al negocio de la carpintería. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar madera y dos cepillos para alisar la madera, debido a que se molesto el que tenía. Con la inversión, dispondrán de materia prima para elaborar unos pedidos  lo más rápido posible, y satisfacer a sus clientes. Para recibir los ingresos que le ayuden a cubrir los gastos de hogar y del estudio de sus hijos y para comprar más ganado.
texts.en:
Flor is 31 years old, and has a partner and two children, with whom she lives. They work with carpentry.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy wood and two brushes, as the ones she had were old. With this investment, they will have the raw materials to make orders as quickly as possible and please their customers. Through this, they will make enough money to cover their household and children's school expenses and buy more livestock.

loans.use: to buy wood and two brushes to smooth the wood, as the ones she had were old.

loans.name: Sorm's Group

texts.en:
Sorm, 37, lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is married with four children, three of whom are dependents and still in school. The main family sources of income are from growing rice and working for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 10 years, she is able to earn about 6,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day.
 
Sorm has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles and completely paid back the loans, which have helped her relieve family burdens and improve her livelihood. Now she is forming a group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sorm is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to make more income, so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Maa Tarini Self Help Group

texts.en:
In 2007, nine women came together and formed the Maa Tarini Self Help Group to save money and help those are facing problems in the group. 

Sabitri is the group member selected as the leader of Maa Tarini Self Help Group. The lady siting in the middle of the photograph and wearing a blue color saree is Sabitri. Sabitri is married and has one son. She is 46 years old and stays with her son and her husband. 

Sabitri has applied for a loan for paddy cultivation. She is very talented and has been operating her business for the past six years. With the loan investment, she will buy fertilizers, pesticides and hybrid seed, and pay the labor charges that will allow her to do her work more efficiently. Her husband is also helping her in the paddy cultivation. 

Sabitri started her business six years ago because it is difficult for her husband to manage the household expenses in addition to paying for their son's education. Her son is enrolled in local schools and getting education. She is confident that her son will be able to continue his education and become successful in life.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing fertilizers, pesticides and hybrid seed, and to pay the labor charges.

loans.name: Maa Mangala Self Help Group

texts.en:
Maa Mangala Self Help Group was formed in 2008 and is composed of ten members in a small village in Odisha. 

Bidulata is the lady who is standing in the middle of the photograph. She is wearing a yellow color saree. Bidulata, age 47, is an educated member of their group, so she was selected as the leader of Maa Mangala Self Help Group. Bidulata has one child. She is living with her husband and her child. Her child is in schooling. 

With the loan that she is receiving, Bidulata plans to boost her agricultural business, and to do so she will purchase chemical fertilizers, rent a field and pay for the cost of labor. In order to strengthen her agricultural business, she plans to improve her strategy and make use of new farming techniques. Both Bidulata and her husband have been involved in this activity for five years. They have good knowledge of paddy cultivation and vegetable cultivation. Bidulata currently grows rice. She has requested a loan to grow her agriculture activity. Her ambition is to expand the business for which she is receiving financial support, and to diversify her activity by growing vegetables.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing seeds and chemical fertilizers, to rent a field and to pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Purnima Self Help Group

texts.en:
Purnima Self Help Group was formed with ten members in 2007 in a small village in Odisha. They all came together to help each other and solve the social issues among them, save money and provide financial support to their families. 

They chose Purnima as the leader of their group. The lady siting second from the right side of the photograph is Purnima. She is a 35-year-old woman living with her husband and her son, age 11. Since seven years ago, Purnima’s husband has been working as a farmer to manage his small family. It is not sufficient to manage the family. So Purnima is helping her husband by working with him and being involved in the milk business. She has three years experience in this business. 

She has requested a loan to buy a cow and fodder so that she can support her family’s income. Purnima says that by selling milk, she can support her family and she can send her son to a good school. Through that, she can provide a better education to her son.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing a cow and fodder and to make a cow shed.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is married with two children who both go to school. She also takes care of her sister. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes  school fees, paying for utility bills and rent for business premises.
