She has a business as a motor spare parts dealer. She works in a shop and sells on retail basis only six days out of every week. She generates additional income through selling sweet potatoes and running a canteen.

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more ball joints and delinks. Her major business challenges include high taxes on spare parts and seasonality. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to start importing spare parts.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts.

loans.name: Berita

texts.es: Berita, de 59 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, está casada con Carlos con quien vive en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Berita es la venta de productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, leche , entre otros. Para eso cuenta con una tienda que está instalada en el mercado de la ciudad, desde  donde atiende a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus las personas que acuden cada mañana a realizar sus compras, lleva un promedio de 10 años en está actividad. Le  gusta su trabajo pues le permite estar a lado de su esposo. Por lo contrario, lo que no le gusta es cuando algunos de sus clientes se retrasan en el pago de sus créditos concedidos, pero eso no la desanima y continua trabajado con las mismas ganas, ahora tiene planes de continuar con su negocio y hacerlo crecer. Este será su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida de contar con un apoyo financiero que le permite seguir adelante. Con el monto solicitado de S/.1000 nuevos soles comprará productos tales como arroz, azúcar, leche , entre otros.
texts.en: Berita is 59 years old and very hard-working and diligent.  She is married to Carlos and they live together in their own house.  Berita sells food products such as rice, sugar, milk and others.  She has a shop in the local market where she tends to her customers.  The majority of her customers come every morning for their shopping.  Berita has spent around ten years in this work and likes it because she can be by her husband's side.  However, one aspect that she does not like is when customers do not pay their tabs.  Berita is not discouraged by this, though, and continues to work equally enthusiastically.  Berita now has plans to continue with her business and expand it.  This will be her first Kiva loan and she is grateful to have financial support that is helping her to get ahead.  With this loan of 1000 Nuevo Soles, Berita will buy products such as rice, sugar, milk and more.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar, milk and more.

loans.name: Baitag

texts.en:
Baitag is 64 years old lives with his wife in a ger in the Hovd province of Mongolia. 

Baitag retired in 1998 and started growing organic vegetables for his family's use and expanded the volume and made it into business. He has lot of experience and regular clients over the years. His wife, Kuldi, stays home to take care of her husband and helps him to grow and sell his organic vegetables. His children got married and live separately. They also runs organic vegetable growing and retail businesses and help their parents too.  

He is now requesting 5,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of seeds and soils and to cover some other expenses regarding plantation season.

loans.use: to purchase large amount of seeds and soils and to cover some other expenses regarding plantation season.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Porfirio tiene 47 años de edad, es padre de 6 hijos todos menores de edad, se dedica a comprar  y criar ganado para  engorde y para producir leche, esta actividad gracias a Dios es la que permite el sustento de su  familia, y el pago de otras obligaciones del hogar. Está solicitando un préstamo por un millón cuarenta  mil  colones (¢1.040.000) 
para continuar desarrollando su proyecto ganadero..
texts.en:
Porfirio, 47, is the father of six children, all underage. He buys and raises cattle for meat and milk production. Thanks to God, this activity allows him to sustain his family and cover the home expenses.

He is requesting a loan of 1,040,000 colones [CRC] to continue developing his project.

loans.use: to buy cattle for meat and milk production.

loans.name: Altansuvd

texts.en:
Mrs. Altansuvd is 42 years old and lives with her son in a Ger (Mongolian housing tent) in the Bulgan province of Mongolia. Her son, Dolgorjav, is 11 years old and studies at a local school. 

Altansuvd has been operating a small bakery at home since 2008. She sells her products in the local market every day during lunch and breakfast time. She has built a close relationship with her clients over the years and is well-known for her tasty and cheap bakery. She is now planning to start producing organic instant noodles at home and is requesting 1,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase equipment to start producing organic noodles at home. She is a hardworking, strong and friendly woman.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to start producing organic noodles at home.

loans.name: Alphunsina

texts.en:
Alphunsina is married with four children, two of whom go to school. She has a business of selling used clothes. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She has been in this business for seven years and works at the market seven days out of every week.  

Her major business challenges include transportation and thieves. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also building her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en: Mr. Altangerel is 35 years-old and he lives with his wife and three children in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife, Doljinsuren, is 31 years-old and currently studying for her masters. His older two children go to the local school and his young son Erdene-Bulgan goes to the local kindergarten. Altangerel has been growing organic vegetables in their plot of land since 2010. He has purchased a big truck to start providing transportation service business during his off-duty time. He is a hardworking and diligent man who is now requesting 1,600,000MNT in order to cover the service expense of making adjustments to his truck to start his transportation business inter-town.

loans.use: to cover the service expense of making adjustments to his truck to start his transportation business inter-town.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard has been involved in agriculture for 25 years. A teacher by profession, Alvard runs a farming business with her husband. They keep livestock, which currently includes 30 chickens, four cows and 10 calves. Alvard also owns agricultural land, where she cultivates different types of vegetables.

Over time, Alvard and her husband have become famous in their area for providing good quality products. They sell the gathered harvest locally and get income that is vital for sustaining their living. 

Realizing that agriculture is very important for them, Alvard and her husband would like to expand it. By requesting this loan, Alvard wants to increase her livestock by one cow, and pay for forage for feeding it. The loan is very important for this family to enlarge their farming business and cover basic needs.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and forage for feeding it.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides and pesticides, and to pay for labourers to sow crops of 14,000 square metres of corn.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem, age 45, is a married woman. Her husband is a government employee but his salary is not enough to meet all the household expenditures. Naseem started her own business of clothes sales to contribute to her family income. She purchases a wide variety of clothes from the market of Faisalabad then sells them to the people of her community. 

She is requesting a loan of Rs. 30,000 through Kiva partner the Kashf Foundation in order to buy a wide variety of clothes of different fabrics in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes of different fabrics in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahira is 43 years-old and the mother of five children. For the past five years, Tahira has been running a business of milk sales. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. With the passage of time, her sales have increased and also her income. Now she has two buffaloes and this has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of Rs. 20000/- in order to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo de 2 años de edad, es muy conocida en la zona donde reside por su humildad y su entrega al trabajo, nunca se ha dejado vencer y siempre ha salido adelante con sus dificultades. Con esfuerzo y dedicación posee una tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, huevos, arroz, sopas, entre otros, es muy dedicada a su labor y muy servicial a la hora de vender, es por eso que posee clientes que la buscan y la prefieren por sus productos. Se ha visto en la necesidad de surtir un poco mas la tienda debido al aumento de demanda y no tiene el capital para realizarlo, es por eso que la clienta solicita un crédito para comprar más productos como granos básicos producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, etc. Confía en Dios de que pronto la ayuda solicitada, será otorgada, y no tendrá más preocupación que llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.
texts.en: The client lives in her own house with her life partner and their two-year-old son. She is very well-known in the zone where she lives due to her humility and her dedication to her job. She has never stopped overcoming the odds, and has always continued forward even when faced with difficulties. With strength and dedication, she owns a store in which she sells commonly used items like basic grains, milk, eggs, rice, soups, and other things. She is very dedicated to her work and a very helpful saleswoman. This is why she has clients who look for her and prefer buying her products. It is necessary to stock her store a little more due to the rise in demand, and she does not have the resources to do this. For this reason, she seeks a loan to buy more products like basic grains, instant products, candies, drinks, etc. She trusts God that the help she seeks will soon be given and she will no longer have to worry about bringing daily sustenance to her home.

loans.use: to buy more products like basic grains, instant products, candy, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Adiyadulam

texts.en:
Adiyadulam is 46 years old and lives with her husband and three children in small house in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her husband, Shagdarsuren, is 36 years old, drives a big truck and provides transportation services in town. Her older two children work at local companies and her youngest son, Yondonjamts, is 15 years old and studies at the local secondary school. 

Adiyadulam has been working at the local market since 2001. She started her own business of second-hand shoes retail in 2011. She has built close relationships with her suppliers and local clients over the years. She is now requesting a loan of 3,200,000 MNT to purchase large amounts of used shoes to sell to local residents. She is a hardworking, responsible and modest woman.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of used shoes to sell to local residents.

loans.name: Mayela

texts.es: Mayela  es una señora muy trabajadora. Necesita un préstamo para comprar almácigo de café (plantas pequeñas en desarrollo) e insumos agrícolas ,  ella se ha dedicado a esta actividad  desde hace varios años y tanto ella como sus hijos dependen de los ingresos que esta labor le proporciona , necesita un crédito por seiscientos  mil colones (600.000), con este financiamiento  continiuará su labor agrícola durante el año.
texts.en: Mayela is a very hard-working woman.  She needs a loan to buy coffee seedlings (small, developing plants) and farming inputs.  She has been in this business for a number of years and both she and her children depend on the income that she makes.  She needs a loan for 600,000 colones so that she can continue her farm work throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings and farming inputs

loans.name: Dayana

texts.es: Dayana es una joven estudiante con muchas metas por lograr , necesita comprar una computadora para realizar los trabajos que le asignan en su escuela, ella nos comenta que se siente apoyada por este tipo de financiamiento  ya que de otra manera no podría adquirir un crédito con tanta facilidad.
texts.en: Dayana is a young student with many goals to achieve, she needs to buy a computer to do the work she is set at school. She says that she feels supported by this type of funding, since she wouldn't be able to get a loan so easily any other way.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa tiene 36 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con mucho trabajo y sacrificio entonces su actividad económica principal es la  venta de comida en uno de los mercados principales de la ciudad de Pilcopata, ella vende sus ricos platos de comida todos los días desde las 6am hasta 4pm. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Qoyllorrity de Pilcopata” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo carne de gallina, carne de cordero, sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas más. 

(La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is 36 years old and has a partner, with whom she has three children. She lives in the city of Pilcopata, and is a hard-working, enterprising individual who supports her family through a lot of hard work and sacrifice. Her main job is selling food in one of the main markets in the city of Pilcopata. She sells her delicious food every day from 6am to 4pm.

For several years, she has been a member of the “Señor de Qoyllorrity de Pilcopata” community bank, and on this occasion she needs a loan to buy ingredients such as chicken, pork, rice, sugar, and other items.

(Pilcopata is the capital of the district of Kosñipata in the province of Paucartambo in Cusco department, Peru).

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as chicken, pork, rice, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Tayyaba

texts.en:
Tayyaba is a 43-year-old hardworking lady. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband. The man shown in the picture is her husband. Her husband purchases stock of goods of daily use from the market at wholesale rates. Both are happily doing it together to meet the expenses of their family members. 

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand of her customers. Its her sixth loan cycle; she is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Jadi

texts.en:
Jadi is 60 years old, married and supports five people. He runs a welding and fabrication business in Kapsabet town. He has been in this business for the last 40 years and gets a monthly income of KES 150,000. 

He has borrowed a loan of KES 72,000, being his 11th loan from KADET Ltd. He intends to use the loan to pay college fees for his son.
 
Jadi continues to anticipate profits, which he will use to educate his children as well as expand his business.

His dream is to start a welding training school to educate members of his community as well as offer employment opportunities to many.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya. She has three children and has been doing farming work for five years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Milking." Her biggest challenge is: "Ecto parasite." Animals on the farm have been given the names of:  "Tepes."

Emily was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "They have agricultural products."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi Kilimo's required microfinance training session: "Record-keeping."

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked, "How will this loan benefit her family?," Emily replied: "I will get milk to feed my farm."

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Emily owns the following: 'cow, poultry, bicycle,' but does not own: 'pig, pump, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards, based on this loan. This borrower has in the household: 'mosquito net, electricity,' but does not have: 'solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD.'

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Amenata

texts.en:
Amenata is 40 years-old and lives in the West point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married, and does not know how to read or write. She has four children aged 21, 19,17, and 15 which live at home and only two attend school. She describes herself as a hardworking woman.

For the past seven years, she has been selling fashion slippers at the local market.  She sells six days a week from 7AM to 5PM.  She likes her business because she has many customers, and she started this business with money given to her by husband.  She uses a shared taxi every time to get her slippers at her business spot. 

Amenata is requesting a loan in order to purchase more slippers for her business. Her dream is to build a house for her children.  She would like to thank  the lenders who support Kiva partner BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz a is 31 year-old married woman and a mother of two. It was very difficult for Shehnaz to manage her household with the small income of her husband. Therefore, she decided to help her husband by earning. For this purpose she started her business of cloth sales as she buys cloths of different varieties from markets and then sells them in her area. Now she is playing a very important role in her family. She applied for a loan of Rs. 25,000/- to purchase a greater variety of cloths in different colors taking into account the taste and choice of her customers. She expects to boost her earnings and aspires to save money for her children’s bright future.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of cloths in different colors.

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es: Doña mirian de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para asistir sus cultivos, sus cosechas las comercializa en los mercados de granaos básicos con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña miriam solicita un credito para poder mejorar el terreno donde piensa hacer su siembra y comprar los insumos necesarios como fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, entre otras cosas para tener buenas cosechas y asi ella pueda obtener  mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Mirian is 56 years old and lives in her own home with her partner and three children. She has made a living growing corn and sorghum for many years and that has given her the experience she needs to look after her crops. She sells her produce in the grain markets, and with the income she manages to pay her household expenses. 

Miriam is requesting a loan to improve the plot of land where she plans to sow her crop, and to buy the necessary inputs such as fertilisers, weed-killers, compost and other items to get a good harvest. In this way she will be able to boost her profits and provide her family with more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, weed-killers, compost, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en: Kenneth is 29 years old, married, and supports a family of two. He runs a retail shop and trades in livestock at the Labuiywo trading centre in Nandi County, which is served by KADET Ltd’s Kapsabet office. This has been his income-generating business for the past four years. He receives an average monthly income of KES 70,000. Kenneth has borrowed KES 50,000, which he intends to use to buy two cows for fattening, in order to sell them at a profit later. He anticipates making more profits, which he intends to use in expanding his business by adding more items to meet clients demand. Kenneth hopes to improve his living standards and to be able to meet his financial needs. He also hopes to save money to enable him to pay school fees for his children in the future, as well as expand his business to a general wholesale's shop.

loans.use: to buy cows to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Tugagaihare Group

texts.en: Maryce, aged 35, borrowed UGX 1,000,000 as part of Tugaigahaire Group’s total loan amount of UGX 8,200,000. She is married and has two children, both of school-going age. She operates a bar in the outskirts of Ishaka town, where she is known for selling the local brew called “mukombotti.” She works every day of the week, 6 hours a day. She does not have any other income. Her business started in 2008, in a rural area she moved from. She started the business to get income to support the family and to pay school fees for the children. She is going to buy more stock, as well as a fridge, for her business. Her clients are local people around the area. She hopes to build a house for her family, since the husband does not do anything. She faces competition from neighbors who are in the same business. She is hardworking, and she hopes for more financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock and a fridge for her bar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items of decorations such as wall hangings, vases, candles and wall mirrors.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad, 26 years old, is from Gaza. He is married and has three children. He has owned a shop that sells cleaning and hygienic materials since 2011. He applied to Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a small automobile for his store. With this loan, he will be able to cut his transportation costs and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a small automobile for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds for his agriculture business and inventory for his wife's grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her tuition fees in order to study for a bachelor's degree in accounting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a zero-grazing unit.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad, 27 years old, is from Gaza. He has owned a shop selling detergents and cleaning materials since 2010. He applied to Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy packaging and filling tools and to install shelves in his shop. He hopes this loan will help him increase the quantity of goods displayed and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy packaging and filling tools, and to install shelves in his shop.

loans.name: Emilia Marina

texts.es:
Emilia vive en la ciudad de Guadalupe, ciudad de cálido clima, pobladores amables y alegres y sobre todo una variada gastronomía. Desde muy joven Emilia aprendió a ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos, es por ello que solo pudo estudiar hasta el primer grado de educación secundaria. Emilia es madre de 6 hijos, los cuales ya son mayores de edad, pero a quienes ama muchísimo y por los cuales ha luchado mucho para convertirlos en personas de bien.

Dia a día Emilia trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, ella prepara sal chipapas, causas, postres, entre otros y con el fruto de su pequeño negocio puede solventar sus gastos del hogar; Ella cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es carismática con los cliente y sobre todo porque a pesar de las adversidades sigue adelante.

Emilia esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mesas, sillas, banquitos, entre otros para poder mejorar su negocio y poder atender a sus clientes con mas comodidad, así podrá tener mas clientes y sobre todo seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener un restaurant y poder seguir apoyando a su familia”.
texts.en:
Emilia lives in the city of Guadalupe, which has a warm climate; friendly, cheerful people; and is best known for its rich cuisine. Emilia's parents didn't have much money, so she completed only one year of high school and has earned a living by the sweat of her brow since she was very young. Emilia has six adult children whom she loves very dearly and for whom she has worked diligently so that they could grow up to be honorable people. 

Emilia works each day selling food. She makes sal chipapas [fried potatoes with hot dogs], causas [potato dumplings], desserts, and other regional dishes. The income from her small business allows Emilia to meet her household expenses. She believes in pushing herself forward as she's very welcoming to her customers despite the challenges she faces. 

Emilia is very grateful for a Kiva loan that will help her to purchase tables, chairs, stools, and other fixtures that will make her customers more comfortable. This will boost her business, bring in more customers, and allow Emilia to continue striving to fulfill her greatest dream: to run a restaurant and continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to purchase tables, chairs, stools, and other fixtures.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en: This group is composed of four members, who live in the same town. Their main businesses involve trading in smoked fish, wigs, hair pomade, hair relaxers and second-hand clothing. This borrower, Mary, is married and has a child living with her. She is the one in the photo with smoked fish in her hand. She is the group leader. Her business involves smoking fish and selling to customers in both the public work sector and the private work sector. She sells fish to help her husband, so that together they give their family a better life. She intends to buy two cartons of fish for GHS 700 to serve her customers better. Her goal is to increase her savings and cover her child's schooling costs. The other members are Perpetual, August and Esther, who sell wigs, hair products and second-hand clothing, respectively.

loans.use: to buy two cartons of fish and serve her customers better.

loans.name: Evelin Del Rocio

texts.es: Evelin de 35 años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden y al gusto de los clientes; evelin es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y muy luchadora día con día se esfuerza al máximo para ganarse una vida mejor y un gran éxito para el futuro, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita  comprar ropa por mayor. evelin tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Evelin, who is 35, lives with her partner and children in a home which they own.  She sells clothing, a business which she has been involved in for a number of years, and the experience she has gained has helped her to make higher profits.  She runs the business from her home and has built up a large clientele because people know that the goods she sells are all of good quality and at affordable prices. Furthermore, she always offers unrivalled service, in line with her customers' expectations and liking. Evelin is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work and very determined.  Everyday, she does her utmost to earn a better living and make a successful future for herself.  Demand has risen over the past few weeks and she wants to take advantage of this to invest in her business again.  However, she has insufficient capital to support this investment and so is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy clothing wholesale.  Evelin has good payment references, is of high moral character and is sure that she will be able to repay her loan and, at the same time, hopes that she will be able to provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Sandra Isabel

texts.es: Sandra de 32 años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; ella necesita invertir por eso le solicita un credito que le permita comprar semillas de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herbicida, etc. Sandra  tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Sandra is 32 years old and lives with her partner and two children in their own home. She makes a living growing corn and beans. She has worked in agriculture for various years and this has given her a lot of experience that allows her to have better harvests. She sells her crops in the neighboring areas of her community and has many customers who prefer her crops for the quality and good prices, but above all, good service. 

She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of corn and bean seedlings, insecticide, herbicide, etc. Sandra has good payment references from people who know her. She is very responsible and is certain that she will be able to pay back her loan in the time period established. At the same time, she is confident that she will bring economic security to her home.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seedlings, insecticide, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: Marco de 40 años de edad vive con sus dos hijos y su esposa en casa propia, el tiene un puesto de comida cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Es un hombre luchador que su empeño es dar lo mejor de si mismo, para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para la subsistencia. Cuenta con la satisfacción de tener clientela fija ya que esta ubicado en un lugar muy transitado. Marco desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas, sillas, mas materia prima arroz, pollos, carne, frijoles, fruta, verduras, etc. para variar su menú y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y poder comprar lo dicho y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Marco is 40 years old and lives with his two children and wife in their own home. He has had a food stall close to his home for many years. With the earnings from his sales he is able to cover the household expenses. He is a hard working man and he perseveres to give the best of himself so that his family does not lack any basic needs. He has the satisfaction of having regular customers because his stall is located in a highly transited area. 

Marco hopes to expand his stall by buying tables and chairs, and more ingredients including rice, chicken, red meat, beans, fruit and vegetables so that he can have a more varied selection of food and greater earnings. However, he does not have enough capital for this investment. It is for this reason that he approached Integral to take out a loan and be able to buy the items mentioned above. In this way he will obtain greater earnings and enjoy greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs, and ingredients including rice, chicken, red meat, beans, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Fassokounawolo Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe FASSOKOUNAWOLO III sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Koba un des villages de la commune de Massigui,  préfecture de Dioîla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres  l’arachide, du riz et  un peu de mil. Elles sont à leur septième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, Setou la première  personne à droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 05 ha de riz et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Massigui, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 150 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the FASSOKOUNAWOLO Iii group are married women who average 39 years of age and three children each. Most of them live in polygamous families in Koba, a village of the commune of Massigui, prefecture of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of Mali).

They have partnered with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to better organize their activities at the start of the rainy season. Their crops include rice and groundnuts, and some millet. This is their 7th time collaborating with the MFI.

With this loan, Setou, standing first from the right, plans to purchase inputs and small farming equipment, and to pay for the plowing of approximately 0.5 hectare of rice and groundnuts.

After the harvest, the crops are sold in Massigui to a clientele composed of both men and women. Setou expects to earn an average profit of about 150,000 FCFA per season.

loans.use: to buy inputs, pesticides, fertilizers and small farming equipment, and to pay for plowing and weeding.

loans.name: Saba

texts.en: Saba is a 23-year-old married lady and the mother of one child. She is very talented and excels in her work selling bed sheets and covers. Her husband is a laborer, but his income is not enough to cover the family’s expenditures. So she decided to start her own business and contribute to her family’s income. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. She needs capital to expand her business. For this reason, she has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy a variety of bed covers, pillows and spreads. The loan will help her to increase her sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan, and she dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy a variety of bed covers, pillows and spreads for her business.

loans.name: Kubran

texts.en: Kubran is a 43 year-old married woman and a mother of one child. She has been involved in the business of weaving sweaters for two years. Her husband makes ice balls on a cart but his income is not sufficient to fulfill the needs of his family members. Kubran works hard to provide better living standards to her family. She beautifully weaves sweaters in different colors and sizes then sells them to the people of her community. Gradually she improved her business and earns enough for a prosperous life. To complete the orders of her customers on time, she applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy bundles of wool and threads in different colors. She hopes to generate more revenue from her business that helps her to provide basic necessities of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy bundles of wool and threads in different colors.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en: Gorret is a single mother of four children and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sisters). She has a business of trading in plastic sandals.  She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more pairs of plastic sandals.  She has been in this business for three years and moves door to door selling sandals.  She works six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis.  Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality.    She aspires to get a permanent business premises and also to educate her children up to university.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.   Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more plastic sandals for sale.

loans.name: Bolathan

texts.en: Mr. Bolathan is 56 years old and lives with his wife in a ger (traditional felt tent) in the Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife Sailau helps her husband to run their family business of growing and selling organic vegetables. Bolathan and his family have been growing and selling organic vegetables on his plot of land since 1996, and they have gained a lot of experience in the business. He has built close relationships with retailers in local markets over the years and sells his products to them. He is now applying for a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy seeds and soil for the planting season. He is planning to plant more organic vegetables this year, to increase his family income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and soil for the planting season at his organic vegetable farm.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 45 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos de la cuales dos son independientes y tres depende todavía de ella, ella vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata y es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con mucho trabajo y sacrificio entonces su actividad económica principal es la  venta de comida de forma ambulatoria, ella vende sus ricos platos de comida todos los días desde las 6am hasta que se acaben. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Qoyllorrity de Pilcopata” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer  mantenimiento de su casa, para comprar carne de gallina, carne de cordero, sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas más. 

(La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Silvia is 45 and lives in the city of Pilcopata. She and her common-law husband have five children, three of whom still live with her. Silvia is very diligent and entrepreneurial, supporting her family through hard work and sacrifice. Her main business is selling food on the street: rich meals that she prepares daily from 6 a.m. until she's sold everything. Silvia has for several years belonged to the “Señor de Qoyllorrity de Pilcopata” ["Lord of Snow Star"] communal bank and is requesting this loan to pay for home repairs and the purchase of lamb and chicken meat, sacks of rice and sugar, and other goods. 

(Pilcopata is the capital of Kosñipata District in Paucartambo Province in the Cusco, Peru Region).

loans.use: to do home repairs, purchase chicken and lamb meat, sacks of rice and sugar, and other goods.

loans.name: Ariyamandal

texts.en: Mrs.Ariyamandal is 46 years old and lives with her husband in an apartment in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her husband, Choijoo, helps his wife to run their family business of retail clothing in the local market. Ariyamandal has been running her clothes retail business in the local market for years. She has good taste in clothes and is well-known among customers. She purchases clothes from China and sells to local customers. She is now requesting 3,500,000MNT to purchase seasonal clothes to sell at her rental stall in the local market. She is a hardworking and welcoming woman.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothes to sell at her rental stall in the local market

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en:
Nickson lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has four children and has been farming for 10 years. His primary income sources are from milk, eggs and tea.

For Nickson, what is most enjoyable about farming is “farming.” His biggest challenge is “poor markets.” Animals on the farm have been named “Chemur.”

His highest monthly expense is school fees. He believes this loan will help him earn more income for the benefit of his family.

Nickson has chosen Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because it offers “good training” before giving loans to farmers.  During Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, he learned that the organization gives loans to groups.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Nickson owns a cow and poultry but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. Nickson has a mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, TV or DVD player.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and sent the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anhbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Anhbayar is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ger, in Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife, Dulmaa, stays home, taking care of her children. His son, Bayanmonh, is eight years old and studies at a local primary school. His daughter, Amarzaya, is five years old and goes to a local kindergarten. 

Anhbayar has been providing a taxi service business in town since 2008. He has purchased an old Russian truck to start providing transportation services inter-city, to increase his family's income. He has been driving various types of cars for years and he is a very experienced driver. 

He is now requesting MNT 6,000,000 to purchase spare parts and to cover repair fees of his truck, to start his transportation service business, inter-city.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and to cover repair fees of his truck, to start his transportation service business, inter-city.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth es madre de dos hijos estudiantes y necesita comprar una computadora para que ellos realicen los  trabajos de la escuela y la única forma de obtenerla es por medio del apoyo financiero de las empresas comunales. está solicitando un crédito por seiscientos mil colones   (¢600.000) para adquirir este artículo.
texts.en: Elizabeth has two children who are students.  She needs to buy a computer so that they can do their schoolwork.  The only way of getting one is through the financial support of the communal enterprises.  She is requesting a loan for six hundred thousand colones in order to get this item.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en: Gulnaz is a 57 year-old married woman. She has successfully run a business of weaving sweaters for the last 20 years. She offers a wide variety of sweaters in different colors and sizes to her customers. Her regular customers are her neighbors. Now she is receiving some orders from a factory but due to lack of capital she is not able to fulfill the demands on time. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 20,000PKR to purchase bundles of wool and threads in different colors. She wants to generate more profit through her business that will allow her to improve the living standard of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wool and threads in different colors.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is a 26-year-old, married woman and a mother of four children. 

The man shown in the photo is Fozia’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services, using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Fozia has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport services to his passengers. 

Fozia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for maintaining her coffee crop.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 57 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos, ella vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata y es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con mucho trabajo y sacrificio entonces su actividad económica principal es la  venta de desayunos, refrescos, gelatinas y leche, ella vende sus ricos desayunos todos los días desde las 5:30am hasta aproximadamente hasta las 8:30 am. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Qoyllorrity de Pilcopata” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para insumos como por ejemplo leche, manzana, quinua, azúcar y otras cosas más. 

(La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en: Julia is 57 and lives with her partner, with whom she has six children.  She lives in the city of Pilcopata and is a hardworking and enterprising person who works tremendously hard and makes sacrifices to provide for her family.  Her main business is selling breakfasts, soft drinks, jellies and milk.  She sells her delicious breakfasts every day from 5.30am until about 8.30am.  She has been a member of the "Señor de Qoyllorrity de Pilopata" communal bank and, on this occasion, she is applying for a loan to buy supplies such as milk, apples, quinoa and sugar, amongst other things.  (The city of Pilcopata is the capital of the district of Kosñipata in Paucartambo province.  Paucartambo province lies within the department of Cusco, Peru).

loans.use: to buy supplies such as milk, apples, quinoa and sugar, amongst other things.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has three children and has been farming for 10 years. His primary income sources are from milk and tea.

For David, what is most enjoyable about his business is “dairy farming.” His biggest challenge is “animal feed.” Animals on his farm have been named “Seroi.”

David’s highest monthly expense is school fees. He believes this loan will help him earn more income for the benefit of his family. 

David chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because of the organization’s “grace period.” During its required micro-finance training session, David learned that Juhudi Kilimo “gives loans to poor farmers.”

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. David owns a cow and poultry but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards because of this loan. David has a mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, TV or DVD player.


Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter (for cutting straw or hay)

loans.name: Anjeline

texts.en:
Anjeline lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk producing area. She has four children and has been doing this work for seven years.  Her primary income sources are milk, crops, personal business. She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Earning from agriculture to meet family needs'.  Her biggest challenge is 'Financial access by farmers is a challenge.'  Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Tetah.'

Anjeline was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Joined Juhudi following the success of other group members in Juhudi.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'How Juhudi works to enable farmers acquire assets to boost income.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How would this loan benefit her family', Anjeline replied, 'Will diversify by starting a poultry project.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Anjeline owns the following: 'cow' but does not own 'pig, poultry, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household '' but does not have 'mosquito net, electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en: Kiran is a 23-year-old single woman. She is a vigorous lady and, for the past three years, has been running a business of cloth sales. She buys cloth in different fabrics and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. She is requesting a loan of Rs 20,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend the part of her profit on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers.

loans.name: Higinio

texts.es: Don Higinio de 40 años de edad es un hombre  muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y su hijo es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra todos los años los uno de los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo es el  maíz, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en sacos a si como muestra la fotografia para luego salir a comercializarla en los mercados que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia. Don Higinio desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Don Higinio is 40 years old and very diligent about meeting his family responsibilities. He lives with his wife and their son and has always provided the best for them, devoting himself to his work cheerfully and enthusiastically. 

Don Higinio is is a farmer and grows one of the principal grain crops of this area, corn. When his corn is ready to harvest, Don Higinio places it in sacks, like the one pictured here, and then takes it to sell at markets hear his home. Don Higinio wishes to boost his sales and therefore visited the offices of INTEGRAL to request a loan for the purchase of: seeds, manure, fertilizers, pesticides, and other supplies. Don Higinio's farm is his only source of income, so this loan will help him provide for his family's daily needs without difficulty.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizers, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en: At the age of 24, Shumaila is an energetic married woman. She has been doing a business of flower-making for three years.  It’s been a passion for her. She knows the method of making beautiful flowers from fabric, paper and other materials. She also arranges handmade wedding garlands for brides and grooms, and makes flowers out of every material she find suitable. The immense experience in the art of flower making has lent her great versatility in making flower to meet her clients' needs. It’s her fourth year with Kashf Foundation and for the improvement of her business she requires a loan of Rs. 40,000/- to buy the additional materials required for making artificial flowers, such as fabric, tissue papers with packs of floral tape, scissors and paints. It will help her to inflate her sales, which ultimately will help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to buy the additional materials required for making artificial flowers such as fabric, tissue papers with packs of floral tape, scissors and paints.

loans.name: Agiri

texts.en: Agiri is widowed and has four children, none of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She has a business of a retail shop and has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 800,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil and rice.  She generates additional income through selling and frying sweet potatoes and cassava. She works in a shop and sells on retail basis only, seven days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality  and thieves.  She aspires to own a fully stocked retail shop and also to buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil and rice.

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en:
Thorn, 35, is married with four children, three of whom are in school. She lives in a rural village in the Moung Russey district of Cambodia. 

Thorn and her husband are hard-working farmers who earn a living by farming rice and raising pigs. They have farmed for almost 10 years. Sometimes, Thorn works for others for a fee. With the current business, they earn about 23,000 Cambodian riel per day to meet the family’s need. 

Thorn has been with VisionFund for four cycles and has completely repaid previous loans, which have helped the family’s business. She is now leading her group in its request for a loan. As the leader, she will buy fertilizers, pesticides and seeds for her farmland and use a portion for labour. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income and make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Bayan

texts.en:
Bayan is a joyful Iraqi entrepreneur, with the true spirit to spread beauty through her arts and crafts work.   She is 55 years old and started her business endeavors with her beauty salon where Relief International staff had the pleasure to meet her. Her salon is a small, reputable establishment attracting many clients in her neighborhood. 

While she is proud of her salon and the successes she had with the business, Bayan's passion is her art work. She makes beautiful crepe paper flowers which she displays in various ways on picture frames to hang as 3D art, in vases as simple bouquets or just as simple individual stem of flowers. The lifelike pieces take about 6-8 hours to make and she is constantly trying out new techniques and new type of flowers. Until now she has been working from her home in her spare time on this precious hobby, and then taking her works to various fairs in town where she can sell her products for about 60-80 dollars each. But unfortunately such fairs are infrequent, and also it takes time and money to attend them. And although she now has a lot of nice and finished pieces, she has no place to really display them and sell them. 

She would like refurbish a little back storage space next to the salon, and use it as a small shop for the decorative pieces. The location is really ideal, as the room has a street front, and with some basic work can easily be turned into a cute shop for her works - an ideal start for a business opportunity she is so passionate about. 

Just Listen to her short video introduction: 
"Hello, my name is Bayan. I learned this art and started working with the raw materials when I was a child and till now I enjoy working and improving my craft. And now I hope to make it even better and take it to the next level. I would like to teach the art and have a few people work with me, and together work on creating both clay ceramics and flowers - as you can see - which are made of crepe (or tissue) paper. And I hope to continuously improve my work and results. Thanks!" 

Bayan is taking an SME loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq to finance the refurbishment of the space and open the shop to display her works.

loans.use: to finance the refurbishment of her building and open a shop to display her works.

loans.name: Murtada

texts.en:
Murtada is a 29-year-old youth client from Iraq, who lives with his parents and his three brothers. Murtada and two of his brothers provide the family income together.

Murtada owns a small shop where he sells cosmetics like makeup, nail polish, creams, and shampoos. He established his business in 2010 and has gained much experience in this field since he used to work at similar shops ever since he was 15 years old until he established his own business. 

Murtada now has an employee and is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Murtada is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD to renovate his shop. He believes that this renovation will attract more customers and will result in the increase of his profits. Murtada aims to save his money so that when the right moment comes, he can get married.

loans.use: to renovate his shop

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola, 23, is married and blessed with one child. She runs a dressmaking business in the Tinderet trading centre and has been in this business for the last four years. She makes a monthly profit of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). With this business, she is able to freely support her family. 

Viola is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES from the Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology, with which she intends to purchase more cloth and other items for dressmaking. She anticipates increasing her profits and using them to purchase more cloth and textiles as well as a sewing machine to boost production.

Her dreams and hopes are to expand her business capacity to other towns, create employment opportunities for those with tailoring skills and boost her family's financial capacity.

loans.use: To purchase cloth in bulk and other dressmaking supplies

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander  es un hombre muy trabajador y emprendedor. Vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos quienes le son de mucha ayuda en las labores diarias . Actualmente está solicitando un crédito de seiscientos  mil colones (¢600.000)  para comprar almácigo de café (plantas pequeñas )para renovar su cafetal e  insumos agrícolas , de esta manera  obtendrá café de buena calidad y económicamente incrementará sus ingresos.
texts.en: Alexander is very hard-working and entrepreneurial. He lives with his wife and two sons, who often help him greatly with his daily work. Alexander is currently requesting a loan of six hundred thousand colones (¢600.000) to purchase coffee seedlings (small plants), to replenish his coffee trees, and agricultural supplies. These steps will allow Alexander to grow high quality coffee and earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase coffee seedlings (small plants) and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Saroet's Group

texts.en:
A resident of a rural village of the Sangke district of Cambodia, Saroet, 37, has two children, who are dependent on him and still in school. The main source of the family’s income is from raising chickens, which Saroet has done for 10 years. His wife sells pork in the village. 

This is the fourth loan with VisionFund for Saroet’s group of two. He has completely repaid past loans with VisionFund. 

He is now leading his group to apply for a loan. As the leader, he will use his portion to buy chicken feed for nourishing his chickens and pork for resale. 

He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his income and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed for nourishing his chickens

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela is a 39-year-old, married woman, doing a business of milk sales for the past four years. Over that time, she has become famous for selling good-quality milk in her community. Her business is good enough to help her lead a decent life. 

Jameela has five children; all are school-going. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life, with good education, food, and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

It’s Jameela's third year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through the support of it. Now, she requests a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase one more buffalo, plus feed for its calves. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately, helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo, plus feed for its calves.

loans.name: Krull Zolin

texts.es:
Krull vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad de cálido clima, en el cual podemos apreciar lugares turísticos y sobre todo se cultiva la uva, el algodón, entre otros. Desde pequeño Krull atravesó por muchos momentos difíciles, debido a que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos, por ello solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Mecánica.

Cada día Krull trabaja como operario de construcción, el trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a sus padres con los gastos del hogar; Krull cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y dedicado.

Krull esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una cocina a gas para su madre ya que actualmente tiene una cocina a kerosene, de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para pode hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir la vivienda de su madre y poder estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Krull lives in the city of Ica, a city with a warm climate where one can see sights and, above all, where grapes and cotton are grown, among others. Since he was little, Krull went through many difficult moments, due to his parents having very few economic resources. Because of this, he could only study up to the 5th year of secondary school, but he would very much like to study mechanical engineering.

Every day, Krull works as a construction operator, and he works about 9 hours per day. With the fruits of his labor, he supports his parents with household expenses. Krull believes he is moving forward because he is very responsible and dedicated.

Krull is very grateful for Kiva loans. Thanks to the help they have given him, he will be able to buy a gas stove for his mother, who currently has a kerosene stove. In this way, he will be able to improve her quality of life and continue fighting to be able to realize his biggest dream: to finish building his mother's house and be able to study at a university.

loans.use: to buy a gas stove.

loans.name: Enebish

texts.en: Mrs. Enebish is 63 years old and lives with her husband in a ger (traditional Mongolian tent) in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband Batsuh is 70 years old. He grows organic vegetables on their plot of land and sells them in the local market. All of their children are married and live separately. Enebish and her husband started their business years ago, and they have obtained a lot of experience and regular clients over the years. She is now requesting 1,200,000 MNT to purchase seeds and soil for seasonal planting of her organic vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and soil for growing organic vegetables

loans.name: Juan Eduardo

texts.es:
Juan es un joven de 25 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad caracterizada por su clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo posee varios atractivos turísticos como la “Laguna de Huacachina”, la bocatoma del inca y también es muy conocida por el cultivo de la uva, el algodón, entre otros. Juan es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que con mucho esfuerzo logro estudiar la carrera de administración  y gracias a ello logro conseguir empleo en una institución de su ciudad, así con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar a sus padres; Juan cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable.

Juan está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su gran ayuda el podrá comprar materiales para mejorar la vivienda de sus padres, ya que actualmente la puerta es de calamina y no cuenta con mucha seguridad, así el podrá darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su propia empresa y ser una gran empresario”.
texts.en:
Juan is a 25 year old young man who lives in the city of Ica.  The city is known for its warm and welcoming climate.  It possesses various tourist attractions like the “Laguna de Huacachina”, the Ica lake.  It is also well-known for cultivating grapes and cotton, among others.

Juan is a young man with a great desire to get ahead.  That is why, with great effort, he managed to study the career of administration.  Thanks to this, he managed to get employment at an institution in his city.  With the fruit of his work, he is able to support his parents.  Juan believes that he is getting ahead because he is responsible.

Juan is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to their great help he will be able to buy materials to improve his parents’ house.  Currently the door is made of corrugated metal, and it is not very safe.  This way he will be able to give his parents a better quality of life.  He will also be able to continue struggling to be able to make his biggest dream a reality, to have his own company and to be a great businessman.

loans.use: to improve his home.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 20 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Imperial, ciudad de clima variado, se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de esparrago, algodón, entre otros. Gladys  es madre de 2 hijos, los cuales tiene 5 y años de edad y a quienes quiere muchísimo y por los cuales trabaja muy duro para poder brindarles un futuro mejor y sobre todo poder ofrecerles una vida digna. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo ´pudo estudiar hasta el cuarto grado de educación secundaría, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de enfermería.

Día a día Gladys trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de frutas, especialmente melones, con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar, es por ello que Gladys trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente; ella cree que está saliendo adelante porque es amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque quiere salir adelante.

Gladys esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una congeladora para la compra de una congeladora ya que actualmente no cuenta con una y en ocasiones la fruta se estropea porque no puede guardarla en un lugar adecuado, de estas manera ella podrá tener un lugar adecuado para la conservación de las frutas y poder mejorar sus ingresos, así ella podra seguir luchando cada día  para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos  y poder ser una gran empresaria”.
texts.en:
Gladys is 20 years old and lives in Imperial, a city with a varied climate whose development is based on agriculture, particularly the cultivation of asparagus and cotton, among other things. Gladys is mother to two five-year-old children who she loves very much, and she works very hard to be able to give them a better future and above all a decent life. Due to her limited economic resources, she was only able to stay in education until the fourth grade of secondary school, but she would have liked to have studied nursing.

Gladys works every day in a small shop selling fruits, in particular melons. With the money she earns she is able to pay the household expenses. She works around nine hours a day and serves about 15 customers a day. She believes that she does well in her job because she is friendly to customers.

Gladys is very grateful to the Kiva lenders; thanks to their help she will be able to buy a freezer as she currently doesn't have one and sometimes her fruit goes bad because she can't keep it in the right conditions. By having somewhere to properly store her fruit she will be able to increase her profits and thereby continue everyday to fight to make her biggest dream come true: to give her children a profession and be the owner of a big business.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Gabriel Antony

texts.es:
Gabriel es un joven de 19 años, el cual vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y también por desarrollarse la agricultura en especial el cultivo de esparrago, uva, algodón, entre otros. Gabirel es un joven que ha atravesado por momentos difíciles y por ello cada día lucha por salir adelante; debido a sus pocos recursos económicos el solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Gabriel trabaja como obrero en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a su familia con los gastos del hogar, el cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es responsable y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Gabriel esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias  a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales como cemento, arena, entre otros; realizar mejoras en su vivienda a que colocara un piso de cemento, ya que actualmente es de tierra, de esta manera el podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Estudiar una carrera universitaria y tener un negocio propio”.
texts.en:
Gabriel is a young 19-year-old living in the city of Ica, a city noted for its very hot climate and also because agriculture develops there especially asparagus, grape and cotton growing, among others.  Gabriel is a young man who has gone through difficult times and that’s why he strives daily to get ahead.  Because of his limited economic resources he was only able to finish fifth grade of secondary school; he would have liked to have gone to university.

Gabriel works day to day as a laborer on a large agricultural estate in his city.  He works about 9 hours per day and helps with his family’s household expenses with the fruits of his labor.  He believes he’s getting ahead because he’s responsible and because he very much wants to get ahead.

Gabriel is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they are giving him he will be able to buy building supplies like cement and sand, among others and will be able to do some home improvements; he will install a cement floor because it’s currently dirt and in this way will be able to improve his family’s quality of life and continue striving to make his greatest dream reality: to study a university career and have a business of his own.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
Majed is a 27-year-old man from a small village, near Jenin City. 

For the past few years, he has been working to raise sheep on a small farm. It has been a profitable business, but Majed would like to improve it by buying feed for his sheep. 

Majed took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy feed for his sheep. By taking this loan, he will produce higher quality products and meat. 

Majed appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy feed for his sheep.

loans.name: Reehana

texts.en: Reehana is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother of four. She and her husband work together to support their family for a better future. One year ago she began doing stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living nearby and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is currently in her first loan cycle and has borrowed 30,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy raw materials including fabric, threads of different colors, and packs of laces and zippers to increase her revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials including fabric, threads of different colors, and packs of laces and zippers

loans.name: Safa'

texts.en:
Safa' is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. 

Safa' is a 30-year-old, married woman from a small village, near Tulkarem City. She is a mother for five young children. Safa's husband has been working in a meat shop as a butcher. It is a profitable business with a good income, but it is not enough to cover the family's needs. 

Safa' took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help the family to develop their house, especially from the outside.

loans.use: to develop their house, especially from the outside.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio tiene 22 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de esparrago, algodón, uva, entre otros. Desde pequeño Julio aprendio a trabajar ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos, por ello y con mucho esfuerzo logro estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería administrativa.

Día a día Julio trabaja para una institución de su ciudad, con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a sus padres  con los gastos del hogar, Julio trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y el cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable.

Julio esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una pequeña moto para poder movilizarse a su centro de labores, ya que su vivienda se encuentra alejada y de esta manera podra ahorrar en movilidad y de esta manera podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y tener su negocio propio”.
texts.en:
Julio, 22, lives in the city of Pisco, a city noted for its hot climate and agriculture, especially asparagus, cotton and grape growing, among others.  Since he was little, Julio learned how to work since his parents were of limited economic resources.  Because of that with much effort he succeeded in studying Administrative Engineering.

Julio works day to day for an institution in his city and is able to help his parents with household expenses with the fruits of his labor.  Julio works about 9 yours daily and believes he’s getting ahead because he’s very responsible.

Julio is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to buy a motorcycle to use to get to work because his house is far and he’ll save on transportation costs this way and be able to continue striving to make his greatest dream reality: to own his own house and his own business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Aydah

texts.en:
Aydah is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her son appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Aydah is a married woman from a small village, near Tulkarem City. She lives in a small house with eight sons and three daughters. Aydah's husband works in a blacksmith workshop and this is the only source of income for the family. 

Aydah would like to complete the family's new home, so she took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help Aydah to buy the construction materials needed to complete her home.

loans.use: to buy the construction materials needed to complete her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the costs of improving his coffee shop.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth es una persona muy sacrificada, que se esfuerza por salir adelante, ella esta estudiando la carrera de Comercio Internacional, con lo cual quiere salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Ruth vive con su madre y hermanos, ella es huérfana de   padre. Trabaja en una tienda y con eso se mantiene y ayuda a su familia y estudia. Sus metas futuras son trabajar en lo que va ser su profesión y tener mejores ingresos. De aquí a un tiempo se ve trabajando en una oficina y tener algún departamento a su cargo.
Solicita de este crédito para pagar sus gastos de la universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en: Ruth is a very self-sacrificing person who strives to get ahead.  She’s studying International Commerce that she hopes she can use to get ahead and help her family.  Ruth lives with her mother and siblings; she’s an orphan on her father’s side.  She works for a store and is able to support herself and help her family with that; she also attends classes.  Her future goal is to work in her future profession and to earn higher income.  She sees herself in time working in an office managing a department.
